module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.BackupRetentionPolicy

-- | A policy that defines the number of days to retain backups.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupRetentionPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data BackupRetentionPolicy
BackupRetentionPolicy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe BackupRetentionType -> BackupRetentionPolicy

-- | Use a value between 7 - 379.
[$sel:value:BackupRetentionPolicy'] :: BackupRetentionPolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of backup retention policy. For the <tt>DAYS</tt> type, the
--   value is the number of days to retain backups.
[$sel:type':BackupRetentionPolicy'] :: BackupRetentionPolicy -> Maybe BackupRetentionType

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupRetentionPolicy</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:BackupRetentionPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>backupRetentionPolicy_value</a> - Use a value between 7 - 379.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':BackupRetentionPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>backupRetentionPolicy_type</a> - The type of backup retention
--   policy. For the <tt>DAYS</tt> type, the value is the number of days to
--   retain backups.
newBackupRetentionPolicy :: BackupRetentionPolicy

-- | Use a value between 7 - 379.
backupRetentionPolicy_value :: Lens' BackupRetentionPolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of backup retention policy. For the <tt>DAYS</tt> type, the
--   value is the number of days to retain backups.
backupRetentionPolicy_type :: Lens' BackupRetentionPolicy (Maybe BackupRetentionType)

module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Certificates

-- | Contains one or more certificates or a certificate signing request
--   (CSR).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCertificates</a> smart constructor.
data Certificates
Certificates' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Certificates

-- | The HSM hardware certificate issued (signed) by the hardware
--   manufacturer.
[$sel:manufacturerHardwareCertificate:Certificates'] :: Certificates -> Maybe Text

-- | The cluster's certificate signing request (CSR). The CSR exists only
--   when the cluster's state is <tt>UNINITIALIZED</tt>.
[$sel:clusterCsr:Certificates'] :: Certificates -> Maybe Text

-- | The HSM certificate issued (signed) by the HSM hardware.
[$sel:hsmCertificate:Certificates'] :: Certificates -> Maybe Text

-- | The cluster certificate issued (signed) by the issuing certificate
--   authority (CA) of the cluster's owner.
[$sel:clusterCertificate:Certificates'] :: Certificates -> Maybe Text

-- | The HSM hardware certificate issued (signed) by AWS CloudHSM.
[$sel:awsHardwareCertificate:Certificates'] :: Certificates -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Certificates</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:manufacturerHardwareCertificate:Certificates'</a>,
--   <a>certificates_manufacturerHardwareCertificate</a> - The HSM hardware
--   certificate issued (signed) by the hardware manufacturer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterCsr:Certificates'</a>, <a>certificates_clusterCsr</a> -
--   The cluster's certificate signing request (CSR). The CSR exists only
--   when the cluster's state is <tt>UNINITIALIZED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmCertificate:Certificates'</a>,
--   <a>certificates_hsmCertificate</a> - The HSM certificate issued
--   (signed) by the HSM hardware.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterCertificate:Certificates'</a>,
--   <a>certificates_clusterCertificate</a> - The cluster certificate
--   issued (signed) by the issuing certificate authority (CA) of the
--   cluster's owner.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsHardwareCertificate:Certificates'</a>,
--   <a>certificates_awsHardwareCertificate</a> - The HSM hardware
--   certificate issued (signed) by AWS CloudHSM.
newCertificates :: Certificates

-- | The HSM hardware certificate issued (signed) by the hardware
--   manufacturer.
certificates_manufacturerHardwareCertificate :: Lens' Certificates (Maybe Text)

-- | The cluster's certificate signing request (CSR). The CSR exists only
--   when the cluster's state is <tt>UNINITIALIZED</tt>.
certificates_clusterCsr :: Lens' Certificates (Maybe Text)

-- | The HSM certificate issued (signed) by the HSM hardware.
certificates_hsmCertificate :: Lens' Certificates (Maybe Text)

-- | The cluster certificate issued (signed) by the issuing certificate
--   authority (CA) of the cluster's owner.
certificates_clusterCertificate :: Lens' Certificates (Maybe Text)

-- | The HSM hardware certificate issued (signed) by AWS CloudHSM.
certificates_awsHardwareCertificate :: Lens' Certificates (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.DestinationBackup

-- | Contains information about the backup that will be copied and created
--   by the CopyBackupToRegion operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDestinationBackup</a> smart constructor.
data DestinationBackup
DestinationBackup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> DestinationBackup

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster containing the source backup from
--   which the new backup was copied.
[$sel:sourceCluster:DestinationBackup'] :: DestinationBackup -> Maybe Text

-- | The AWS region that contains the source backup from which the new
--   backup was copied.
[$sel:sourceRegion:DestinationBackup'] :: DestinationBackup -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier (ID) of the source backup from which the new backup was
--   copied.
[$sel:sourceBackup:DestinationBackup'] :: DestinationBackup -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when both the source backup was created.
[$sel:createTimestamp:DestinationBackup'] :: DestinationBackup -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>DestinationBackup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceCluster:DestinationBackup'</a>,
--   <a>destinationBackup_sourceCluster</a> - The identifier (ID) of the
--   cluster containing the source backup from which the new backup was
--   copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceRegion:DestinationBackup'</a>,
--   <a>destinationBackup_sourceRegion</a> - The AWS region that contains
--   the source backup from which the new backup was copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceBackup:DestinationBackup'</a>,
--   <a>destinationBackup_sourceBackup</a> - The identifier (ID) of the
--   source backup from which the new backup was copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createTimestamp:DestinationBackup'</a>,
--   <a>destinationBackup_createTimestamp</a> - The date and time when both
--   the source backup was created.
newDestinationBackup :: DestinationBackup

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster containing the source backup from
--   which the new backup was copied.
destinationBackup_sourceCluster :: Lens' DestinationBackup (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS region that contains the source backup from which the new
--   backup was copied.
destinationBackup_sourceRegion :: Lens' DestinationBackup (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the source backup from which the new backup was
--   copied.
destinationBackup_sourceBackup :: Lens' DestinationBackup (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when both the source backup was created.
destinationBackup_createTimestamp :: Lens' DestinationBackup (Maybe UTCTime)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.DestinationBackup.DestinationBackup

module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Hsm

-- | Contains information about a hardware security module (HSM) in an AWS
--   CloudHSM cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHsm</a> smart constructor.
data Hsm
Hsm' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe HsmState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Hsm

-- | A description of the HSM's state.
[$sel:stateMessage:Hsm'] :: Hsm -> Maybe Text

-- | The HSM's state.
[$sel:state:Hsm'] :: Hsm -> Maybe HsmState

-- | The identifier (ID) of the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
[$sel:eniId:Hsm'] :: Hsm -> Maybe Text

-- | The subnet that contains the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
[$sel:subnetId:Hsm'] :: Hsm -> Maybe Text

-- | The Availability Zone that contains the HSM.
[$sel:availabilityZone:Hsm'] :: Hsm -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that contains the HSM.
[$sel:clusterId:Hsm'] :: Hsm -> Maybe Text

-- | The IP address of the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
[$sel:eniIp:Hsm'] :: Hsm -> Maybe Text

-- | The HSM's identifier (ID).
[$sel:hsmId:Hsm'] :: Hsm -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Hsm</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateMessage:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_stateMessage</a> - A description
--   of the HSM's state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_state</a> - The HSM's state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eniId:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_eniId</a> - The identifier (ID) of the
--   HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetId:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_subnetId</a> - The subnet that
--   contains the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_availabilityZone</a> - The
--   Availability Zone that contains the HSM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_clusterId</a> - The identifier (ID)
--   of the cluster that contains the HSM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eniIp:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_eniIp</a> - The IP address of the HSM's
--   elastic network interface (ENI).
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmId:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_hsmId</a> - The HSM's identifier (ID).
newHsm :: Text -> Hsm

-- | A description of the HSM's state.
hsm_stateMessage :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The HSM's state.
hsm_state :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe HsmState)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
hsm_eniId :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The subnet that contains the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
hsm_subnetId :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The Availability Zone that contains the HSM.
hsm_availabilityZone :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that contains the HSM.
hsm_clusterId :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP address of the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
hsm_eniIp :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The HSM's identifier (ID).
hsm_hsmId :: Lens' Hsm Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Hsm.Hsm
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Hsm.Hsm
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Hsm.Hsm
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Hsm.Hsm
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Hsm.Hsm
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Hsm.Hsm
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Hsm.Hsm


module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Tag

-- | Contains a tag. A tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | The key of the tag.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | The value of the tag.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - The key of the tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The value of the tag.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | The key of the tag.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The value of the tag.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Tag.Tag


module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Cluster

-- | Contains information about an AWS CloudHSM cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCluster</a> smart constructor.
data Cluster
Cluster' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ClusterState -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe BackupRetentionPolicy -> Maybe [Hsm] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Certificates -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe BackupPolicy -> Maybe Text -> Cluster

-- | The default password for the cluster's Pre-Crypto Officer (PRECO)
--   user.
[$sel:preCoPassword:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of the cluster's state.
[$sel:stateMessage:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The cluster's state.
[$sel:state:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe ClusterState

-- | A map from availability zone to the cluster’s subnet in that
--   availability zone.
[$sel:subnetMapping:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | A policy that defines how the service retains backups.
[$sel:backupRetentionPolicy:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe BackupRetentionPolicy

-- | Contains information about the HSMs in the cluster.
[$sel:hsms:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [Hsm]

-- | The identifier (ID) of the virtual private cloud (VPC) that contains
--   the cluster.
[$sel:vpcId:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of tags for the cluster.
[$sel:tagList:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The identifier (ID) of the backup used to create the cluster. This
--   value exists only when the cluster was created from a backup.
[$sel:sourceBackupId:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains one or more certificates or a certificate signing request
--   (CSR).
[$sel:certificates:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Certificates

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster's security group.
[$sel:securityGroup:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The cluster's identifier (ID).
[$sel:clusterId:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when the cluster was created.
[$sel:createTimestamp:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The cluster's backup policy.
[$sel:backupPolicy:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe BackupPolicy

-- | The type of HSM that the cluster contains.
[$sel:hsmType:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Cluster</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:preCoPassword:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_preCoPassword</a> - The
--   default password for the cluster's Pre-Crypto Officer (PRECO) user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateMessage:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_stateMessage</a> - A
--   description of the cluster's state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_state</a> - The cluster's
--   state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetMapping:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_subnetMapping</a> - A
--   map from availability zone to the cluster’s subnet in that
--   availability zone.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupRetentionPolicy:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_backupRetentionPolicy</a> - A policy that defines how the
--   service retains backups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsms:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_hsms</a> - Contains information
--   about the HSMs in the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_vpcId</a> - The identifier (ID)
--   of the virtual private cloud (VPC) that contains the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_tagList</a> - The list of
--   tags for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceBackupId:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_sourceBackupId</a> -
--   The identifier (ID) of the backup used to create the cluster. This
--   value exists only when the cluster was created from a backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificates:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_certificates</a> -
--   Contains one or more certificates or a certificate signing request
--   (CSR).
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroup:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_securityGroup</a> - The
--   identifier (ID) of the cluster's security group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_clusterId</a> - The
--   cluster's identifier (ID).
--   
--   <a>$sel:createTimestamp:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_createTimestamp</a> -
--   The date and time when the cluster was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPolicy:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_backupPolicy</a> - The
--   cluster's backup policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmType:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_hsmType</a> - The type of HSM
--   that the cluster contains.
newCluster :: Cluster

-- | The default password for the cluster's Pre-Crypto Officer (PRECO)
--   user.
cluster_preCoPassword :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of the cluster's state.
cluster_stateMessage :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The cluster's state.
cluster_state :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe ClusterState)

-- | A map from availability zone to the cluster’s subnet in that
--   availability zone.
cluster_subnetMapping :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A policy that defines how the service retains backups.
cluster_backupRetentionPolicy :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe BackupRetentionPolicy)

-- | Contains information about the HSMs in the cluster.
cluster_hsms :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [Hsm])

-- | The identifier (ID) of the virtual private cloud (VPC) that contains
--   the cluster.
cluster_vpcId :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags for the cluster.
cluster_tagList :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The identifier (ID) of the backup used to create the cluster. This
--   value exists only when the cluster was created from a backup.
cluster_sourceBackupId :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains one or more certificates or a certificate signing request
--   (CSR).
cluster_certificates :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Certificates)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster's security group.
cluster_securityGroup :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The cluster's identifier (ID).
cluster_clusterId :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the cluster was created.
cluster_createTimestamp :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The cluster's backup policy.
cluster_backupPolicy :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe BackupPolicy)

-- | The type of HSM that the cluster contains.
cluster_hsmType :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Cluster.Cluster
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Cluster.Cluster
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Cluster.Cluster
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Cluster.Cluster
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Cluster.Cluster
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Cluster.Cluster
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Cluster.Cluster


module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Backup

-- | Contains information about a backup of an AWS CloudHSM cluster. All
--   backup objects contain the <tt>BackupId</tt>, <tt>BackupState</tt>,
--   <tt>ClusterId</tt>, and <tt>CreateTimestamp</tt> parameters. Backups
--   that were copied into a destination region additionally contain the
--   <tt>CopyTimestamp</tt>, <tt>SourceBackup</tt>, <tt>SourceCluster</tt>,
--   and <tt>SourceRegion</tt> parameters. A backup that is pending
--   deletion will include the <tt>DeleteTimestamp</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackup</a> smart constructor.
data Backup
Backup' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe BackupState -> Text -> Backup

-- | The date and time when the backup will be permanently deleted.
[$sel:deleteTimestamp:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster containing the source backup from
--   which the new backup was copied.
[$sel:sourceCluster:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the service should exempt a backup from the
--   retention policy for the cluster. <tt>True</tt> exempts a backup from
--   the retention policy. <tt>False</tt> means the service applies the
--   backup retention policy defined at the cluster.
[$sel:neverExpires:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe Bool

-- | The AWS Region that contains the source backup from which the new
--   backup was copied.
[$sel:sourceRegion:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of tags for the backup.
[$sel:tagList:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The identifier (ID) of the source backup from which the new backup was
--   copied.
[$sel:sourceBackup:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that was backed up.
[$sel:clusterId:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when the backup was created.
[$sel:createTimestamp:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time when the backup was copied from a source backup.
[$sel:copyTimestamp:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The state of the backup.
[$sel:backupState:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe BackupState

-- | The identifier (ID) of the backup.
[$sel:backupId:Backup'] :: Backup -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Backup</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteTimestamp:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_deleteTimestamp</a> -
--   The date and time when the backup will be permanently deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceCluster:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_sourceCluster</a> - The
--   identifier (ID) of the cluster containing the source backup from which
--   the new backup was copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:neverExpires:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_neverExpires</a> -
--   Specifies whether the service should exempt a backup from the
--   retention policy for the cluster. <tt>True</tt> exempts a backup from
--   the retention policy. <tt>False</tt> means the service applies the
--   backup retention policy defined at the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceRegion:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_sourceRegion</a> - The AWS
--   Region that contains the source backup from which the new backup was
--   copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_tagList</a> - The list of tags
--   for the backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceBackup:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_sourceBackup</a> - The
--   identifier (ID) of the source backup from which the new backup was
--   copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_clusterId</a> - The
--   identifier (ID) of the cluster that was backed up.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createTimestamp:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_createTimestamp</a> -
--   The date and time when the backup was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copyTimestamp:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_copyTimestamp</a> - The
--   date and time when the backup was copied from a source backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupState:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_backupState</a> - The state
--   of the backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupId:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_backupId</a> - The identifier
--   (ID) of the backup.
newBackup :: Text -> Backup

-- | The date and time when the backup will be permanently deleted.
backup_deleteTimestamp :: Lens' Backup (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster containing the source backup from
--   which the new backup was copied.
backup_sourceCluster :: Lens' Backup (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the service should exempt a backup from the
--   retention policy for the cluster. <tt>True</tt> exempts a backup from
--   the retention policy. <tt>False</tt> means the service applies the
--   backup retention policy defined at the cluster.
backup_neverExpires :: Lens' Backup (Maybe Bool)

-- | The AWS Region that contains the source backup from which the new
--   backup was copied.
backup_sourceRegion :: Lens' Backup (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags for the backup.
backup_tagList :: Lens' Backup (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The identifier (ID) of the source backup from which the new backup was
--   copied.
backup_sourceBackup :: Lens' Backup (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that was backed up.
backup_clusterId :: Lens' Backup (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the backup was created.
backup_createTimestamp :: Lens' Backup (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time when the backup was copied from a source backup.
backup_copyTimestamp :: Lens' Backup (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The state of the backup.
backup_backupState :: Lens' Backup (Maybe BackupState)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the backup.
backup_backupId :: Lens' Backup Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Backup.Backup
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Backup.Backup
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Backup.Backup
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Backup.Backup
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Backup.Backup
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Backup.Backup
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types.Backup.Backup


module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Types

-- | API version <tt>2017-04-28</tt> of the Amazon CloudHSM V2 SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The request was rejected because of an AWS CloudHSM internal failure.
--   The request can be retried.
_CloudHsmInternalFailureException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because an error occurred.
_CloudHsmServiceException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because it is not a valid request.
_CloudHsmInvalidRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because the requester does not have
--   permission to perform the requested operation.
_CloudHsmAccessDeniedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because it refers to a resource that cannot
--   be found.
_CloudHsmResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because of a tagging failure. Verify the tag
--   conditions in all applicable policies, and then retry the request.
_CloudHsmTagException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
newtype BackupPolicy
BackupPolicy' :: Text -> BackupPolicy
[fromBackupPolicy] :: BackupPolicy -> Text
pattern BackupPolicy_DEFAULT :: BackupPolicy
newtype BackupRetentionType
BackupRetentionType' :: Text -> BackupRetentionType
[fromBackupRetentionType] :: BackupRetentionType -> Text
pattern BackupRetentionType_DAYS :: BackupRetentionType
newtype BackupState
BackupState' :: Text -> BackupState
[fromBackupState] :: BackupState -> Text
pattern BackupState_CREATE_IN_PROGRESS :: BackupState
pattern BackupState_DELETED :: BackupState
pattern BackupState_PENDING_DELETION :: BackupState
pattern BackupState_READY :: BackupState
newtype ClusterState
ClusterState' :: Text -> ClusterState
[fromClusterState] :: ClusterState -> Text
pattern ClusterState_ACTIVE :: ClusterState
pattern ClusterState_CREATE_IN_PROGRESS :: ClusterState
pattern ClusterState_DEGRADED :: ClusterState
pattern ClusterState_DELETED :: ClusterState
pattern ClusterState_DELETE_IN_PROGRESS :: ClusterState
pattern ClusterState_INITIALIZED :: ClusterState
pattern ClusterState_INITIALIZE_IN_PROGRESS :: ClusterState
pattern ClusterState_UNINITIALIZED :: ClusterState
pattern ClusterState_UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS :: ClusterState
newtype HsmState
HsmState' :: Text -> HsmState
[fromHsmState] :: HsmState -> Text
pattern HsmState_ACTIVE :: HsmState
pattern HsmState_CREATE_IN_PROGRESS :: HsmState
pattern HsmState_DEGRADED :: HsmState
pattern HsmState_DELETED :: HsmState
pattern HsmState_DELETE_IN_PROGRESS :: HsmState

-- | Contains information about a backup of an AWS CloudHSM cluster. All
--   backup objects contain the <tt>BackupId</tt>, <tt>BackupState</tt>,
--   <tt>ClusterId</tt>, and <tt>CreateTimestamp</tt> parameters. Backups
--   that were copied into a destination region additionally contain the
--   <tt>CopyTimestamp</tt>, <tt>SourceBackup</tt>, <tt>SourceCluster</tt>,
--   and <tt>SourceRegion</tt> parameters. A backup that is pending
--   deletion will include the <tt>DeleteTimestamp</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackup</a> smart constructor.
data Backup
Backup' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe BackupState -> Text -> Backup

-- | The date and time when the backup will be permanently deleted.
[$sel:deleteTimestamp:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster containing the source backup from
--   which the new backup was copied.
[$sel:sourceCluster:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the service should exempt a backup from the
--   retention policy for the cluster. <tt>True</tt> exempts a backup from
--   the retention policy. <tt>False</tt> means the service applies the
--   backup retention policy defined at the cluster.
[$sel:neverExpires:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe Bool

-- | The AWS Region that contains the source backup from which the new
--   backup was copied.
[$sel:sourceRegion:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of tags for the backup.
[$sel:tagList:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The identifier (ID) of the source backup from which the new backup was
--   copied.
[$sel:sourceBackup:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that was backed up.
[$sel:clusterId:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when the backup was created.
[$sel:createTimestamp:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time when the backup was copied from a source backup.
[$sel:copyTimestamp:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The state of the backup.
[$sel:backupState:Backup'] :: Backup -> Maybe BackupState

-- | The identifier (ID) of the backup.
[$sel:backupId:Backup'] :: Backup -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Backup</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteTimestamp:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_deleteTimestamp</a> -
--   The date and time when the backup will be permanently deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceCluster:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_sourceCluster</a> - The
--   identifier (ID) of the cluster containing the source backup from which
--   the new backup was copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:neverExpires:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_neverExpires</a> -
--   Specifies whether the service should exempt a backup from the
--   retention policy for the cluster. <tt>True</tt> exempts a backup from
--   the retention policy. <tt>False</tt> means the service applies the
--   backup retention policy defined at the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceRegion:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_sourceRegion</a> - The AWS
--   Region that contains the source backup from which the new backup was
--   copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_tagList</a> - The list of tags
--   for the backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceBackup:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_sourceBackup</a> - The
--   identifier (ID) of the source backup from which the new backup was
--   copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_clusterId</a> - The
--   identifier (ID) of the cluster that was backed up.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createTimestamp:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_createTimestamp</a> -
--   The date and time when the backup was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copyTimestamp:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_copyTimestamp</a> - The
--   date and time when the backup was copied from a source backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupState:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_backupState</a> - The state
--   of the backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupId:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_backupId</a> - The identifier
--   (ID) of the backup.
newBackup :: Text -> Backup

-- | The date and time when the backup will be permanently deleted.
backup_deleteTimestamp :: Lens' Backup (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster containing the source backup from
--   which the new backup was copied.
backup_sourceCluster :: Lens' Backup (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the service should exempt a backup from the
--   retention policy for the cluster. <tt>True</tt> exempts a backup from
--   the retention policy. <tt>False</tt> means the service applies the
--   backup retention policy defined at the cluster.
backup_neverExpires :: Lens' Backup (Maybe Bool)

-- | The AWS Region that contains the source backup from which the new
--   backup was copied.
backup_sourceRegion :: Lens' Backup (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags for the backup.
backup_tagList :: Lens' Backup (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The identifier (ID) of the source backup from which the new backup was
--   copied.
backup_sourceBackup :: Lens' Backup (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that was backed up.
backup_clusterId :: Lens' Backup (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the backup was created.
backup_createTimestamp :: Lens' Backup (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time when the backup was copied from a source backup.
backup_copyTimestamp :: Lens' Backup (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The state of the backup.
backup_backupState :: Lens' Backup (Maybe BackupState)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the backup.
backup_backupId :: Lens' Backup Text

-- | A policy that defines the number of days to retain backups.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupRetentionPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data BackupRetentionPolicy
BackupRetentionPolicy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe BackupRetentionType -> BackupRetentionPolicy

-- | Use a value between 7 - 379.
[$sel:value:BackupRetentionPolicy'] :: BackupRetentionPolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of backup retention policy. For the <tt>DAYS</tt> type, the
--   value is the number of days to retain backups.
[$sel:type':BackupRetentionPolicy'] :: BackupRetentionPolicy -> Maybe BackupRetentionType

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupRetentionPolicy</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:BackupRetentionPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>backupRetentionPolicy_value</a> - Use a value between 7 - 379.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':BackupRetentionPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>backupRetentionPolicy_type</a> - The type of backup retention
--   policy. For the <tt>DAYS</tt> type, the value is the number of days to
--   retain backups.
newBackupRetentionPolicy :: BackupRetentionPolicy

-- | Use a value between 7 - 379.
backupRetentionPolicy_value :: Lens' BackupRetentionPolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of backup retention policy. For the <tt>DAYS</tt> type, the
--   value is the number of days to retain backups.
backupRetentionPolicy_type :: Lens' BackupRetentionPolicy (Maybe BackupRetentionType)

-- | Contains one or more certificates or a certificate signing request
--   (CSR).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCertificates</a> smart constructor.
data Certificates
Certificates' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Certificates

-- | The HSM hardware certificate issued (signed) by the hardware
--   manufacturer.
[$sel:manufacturerHardwareCertificate:Certificates'] :: Certificates -> Maybe Text

-- | The cluster's certificate signing request (CSR). The CSR exists only
--   when the cluster's state is <tt>UNINITIALIZED</tt>.
[$sel:clusterCsr:Certificates'] :: Certificates -> Maybe Text

-- | The HSM certificate issued (signed) by the HSM hardware.
[$sel:hsmCertificate:Certificates'] :: Certificates -> Maybe Text

-- | The cluster certificate issued (signed) by the issuing certificate
--   authority (CA) of the cluster's owner.
[$sel:clusterCertificate:Certificates'] :: Certificates -> Maybe Text

-- | The HSM hardware certificate issued (signed) by AWS CloudHSM.
[$sel:awsHardwareCertificate:Certificates'] :: Certificates -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Certificates</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:manufacturerHardwareCertificate:Certificates'</a>,
--   <a>certificates_manufacturerHardwareCertificate</a> - The HSM hardware
--   certificate issued (signed) by the hardware manufacturer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterCsr:Certificates'</a>, <a>certificates_clusterCsr</a> -
--   The cluster's certificate signing request (CSR). The CSR exists only
--   when the cluster's state is <tt>UNINITIALIZED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmCertificate:Certificates'</a>,
--   <a>certificates_hsmCertificate</a> - The HSM certificate issued
--   (signed) by the HSM hardware.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterCertificate:Certificates'</a>,
--   <a>certificates_clusterCertificate</a> - The cluster certificate
--   issued (signed) by the issuing certificate authority (CA) of the
--   cluster's owner.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsHardwareCertificate:Certificates'</a>,
--   <a>certificates_awsHardwareCertificate</a> - The HSM hardware
--   certificate issued (signed) by AWS CloudHSM.
newCertificates :: Certificates

-- | The HSM hardware certificate issued (signed) by the hardware
--   manufacturer.
certificates_manufacturerHardwareCertificate :: Lens' Certificates (Maybe Text)

-- | The cluster's certificate signing request (CSR). The CSR exists only
--   when the cluster's state is <tt>UNINITIALIZED</tt>.
certificates_clusterCsr :: Lens' Certificates (Maybe Text)

-- | The HSM certificate issued (signed) by the HSM hardware.
certificates_hsmCertificate :: Lens' Certificates (Maybe Text)

-- | The cluster certificate issued (signed) by the issuing certificate
--   authority (CA) of the cluster's owner.
certificates_clusterCertificate :: Lens' Certificates (Maybe Text)

-- | The HSM hardware certificate issued (signed) by AWS CloudHSM.
certificates_awsHardwareCertificate :: Lens' Certificates (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains information about an AWS CloudHSM cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCluster</a> smart constructor.
data Cluster
Cluster' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ClusterState -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe BackupRetentionPolicy -> Maybe [Hsm] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Certificates -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe BackupPolicy -> Maybe Text -> Cluster

-- | The default password for the cluster's Pre-Crypto Officer (PRECO)
--   user.
[$sel:preCoPassword:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of the cluster's state.
[$sel:stateMessage:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The cluster's state.
[$sel:state:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe ClusterState

-- | A map from availability zone to the cluster’s subnet in that
--   availability zone.
[$sel:subnetMapping:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | A policy that defines how the service retains backups.
[$sel:backupRetentionPolicy:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe BackupRetentionPolicy

-- | Contains information about the HSMs in the cluster.
[$sel:hsms:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [Hsm]

-- | The identifier (ID) of the virtual private cloud (VPC) that contains
--   the cluster.
[$sel:vpcId:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of tags for the cluster.
[$sel:tagList:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The identifier (ID) of the backup used to create the cluster. This
--   value exists only when the cluster was created from a backup.
[$sel:sourceBackupId:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains one or more certificates or a certificate signing request
--   (CSR).
[$sel:certificates:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Certificates

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster's security group.
[$sel:securityGroup:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The cluster's identifier (ID).
[$sel:clusterId:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when the cluster was created.
[$sel:createTimestamp:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The cluster's backup policy.
[$sel:backupPolicy:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe BackupPolicy

-- | The type of HSM that the cluster contains.
[$sel:hsmType:Cluster'] :: Cluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Cluster</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:preCoPassword:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_preCoPassword</a> - The
--   default password for the cluster's Pre-Crypto Officer (PRECO) user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateMessage:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_stateMessage</a> - A
--   description of the cluster's state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_state</a> - The cluster's
--   state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetMapping:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_subnetMapping</a> - A
--   map from availability zone to the cluster’s subnet in that
--   availability zone.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupRetentionPolicy:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_backupRetentionPolicy</a> - A policy that defines how the
--   service retains backups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsms:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_hsms</a> - Contains information
--   about the HSMs in the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_vpcId</a> - The identifier (ID)
--   of the virtual private cloud (VPC) that contains the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_tagList</a> - The list of
--   tags for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceBackupId:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_sourceBackupId</a> -
--   The identifier (ID) of the backup used to create the cluster. This
--   value exists only when the cluster was created from a backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificates:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_certificates</a> -
--   Contains one or more certificates or a certificate signing request
--   (CSR).
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroup:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_securityGroup</a> - The
--   identifier (ID) of the cluster's security group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_clusterId</a> - The
--   cluster's identifier (ID).
--   
--   <a>$sel:createTimestamp:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_createTimestamp</a> -
--   The date and time when the cluster was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPolicy:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_backupPolicy</a> - The
--   cluster's backup policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmType:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_hsmType</a> - The type of HSM
--   that the cluster contains.
newCluster :: Cluster

-- | The default password for the cluster's Pre-Crypto Officer (PRECO)
--   user.
cluster_preCoPassword :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of the cluster's state.
cluster_stateMessage :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The cluster's state.
cluster_state :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe ClusterState)

-- | A map from availability zone to the cluster’s subnet in that
--   availability zone.
cluster_subnetMapping :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A policy that defines how the service retains backups.
cluster_backupRetentionPolicy :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe BackupRetentionPolicy)

-- | Contains information about the HSMs in the cluster.
cluster_hsms :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [Hsm])

-- | The identifier (ID) of the virtual private cloud (VPC) that contains
--   the cluster.
cluster_vpcId :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags for the cluster.
cluster_tagList :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The identifier (ID) of the backup used to create the cluster. This
--   value exists only when the cluster was created from a backup.
cluster_sourceBackupId :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains one or more certificates or a certificate signing request
--   (CSR).
cluster_certificates :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Certificates)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster's security group.
cluster_securityGroup :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The cluster's identifier (ID).
cluster_clusterId :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the cluster was created.
cluster_createTimestamp :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The cluster's backup policy.
cluster_backupPolicy :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe BackupPolicy)

-- | The type of HSM that the cluster contains.
cluster_hsmType :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains information about the backup that will be copied and created
--   by the CopyBackupToRegion operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDestinationBackup</a> smart constructor.
data DestinationBackup
DestinationBackup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> DestinationBackup

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster containing the source backup from
--   which the new backup was copied.
[$sel:sourceCluster:DestinationBackup'] :: DestinationBackup -> Maybe Text

-- | The AWS region that contains the source backup from which the new
--   backup was copied.
[$sel:sourceRegion:DestinationBackup'] :: DestinationBackup -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier (ID) of the source backup from which the new backup was
--   copied.
[$sel:sourceBackup:DestinationBackup'] :: DestinationBackup -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when both the source backup was created.
[$sel:createTimestamp:DestinationBackup'] :: DestinationBackup -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>DestinationBackup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceCluster:DestinationBackup'</a>,
--   <a>destinationBackup_sourceCluster</a> - The identifier (ID) of the
--   cluster containing the source backup from which the new backup was
--   copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceRegion:DestinationBackup'</a>,
--   <a>destinationBackup_sourceRegion</a> - The AWS region that contains
--   the source backup from which the new backup was copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceBackup:DestinationBackup'</a>,
--   <a>destinationBackup_sourceBackup</a> - The identifier (ID) of the
--   source backup from which the new backup was copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createTimestamp:DestinationBackup'</a>,
--   <a>destinationBackup_createTimestamp</a> - The date and time when both
--   the source backup was created.
newDestinationBackup :: DestinationBackup

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster containing the source backup from
--   which the new backup was copied.
destinationBackup_sourceCluster :: Lens' DestinationBackup (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS region that contains the source backup from which the new
--   backup was copied.
destinationBackup_sourceRegion :: Lens' DestinationBackup (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the source backup from which the new backup was
--   copied.
destinationBackup_sourceBackup :: Lens' DestinationBackup (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when both the source backup was created.
destinationBackup_createTimestamp :: Lens' DestinationBackup (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Contains information about a hardware security module (HSM) in an AWS
--   CloudHSM cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHsm</a> smart constructor.
data Hsm
Hsm' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe HsmState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Hsm

-- | A description of the HSM's state.
[$sel:stateMessage:Hsm'] :: Hsm -> Maybe Text

-- | The HSM's state.
[$sel:state:Hsm'] :: Hsm -> Maybe HsmState

-- | The identifier (ID) of the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
[$sel:eniId:Hsm'] :: Hsm -> Maybe Text

-- | The subnet that contains the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
[$sel:subnetId:Hsm'] :: Hsm -> Maybe Text

-- | The Availability Zone that contains the HSM.
[$sel:availabilityZone:Hsm'] :: Hsm -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that contains the HSM.
[$sel:clusterId:Hsm'] :: Hsm -> Maybe Text

-- | The IP address of the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
[$sel:eniIp:Hsm'] :: Hsm -> Maybe Text

-- | The HSM's identifier (ID).
[$sel:hsmId:Hsm'] :: Hsm -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Hsm</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateMessage:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_stateMessage</a> - A description
--   of the HSM's state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_state</a> - The HSM's state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eniId:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_eniId</a> - The identifier (ID) of the
--   HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetId:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_subnetId</a> - The subnet that
--   contains the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_availabilityZone</a> - The
--   Availability Zone that contains the HSM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_clusterId</a> - The identifier (ID)
--   of the cluster that contains the HSM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eniIp:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_eniIp</a> - The IP address of the HSM's
--   elastic network interface (ENI).
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmId:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_hsmId</a> - The HSM's identifier (ID).
newHsm :: Text -> Hsm

-- | A description of the HSM's state.
hsm_stateMessage :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The HSM's state.
hsm_state :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe HsmState)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
hsm_eniId :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The subnet that contains the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
hsm_subnetId :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The Availability Zone that contains the HSM.
hsm_availabilityZone :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that contains the HSM.
hsm_clusterId :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP address of the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
hsm_eniIp :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The HSM's identifier (ID).
hsm_hsmId :: Lens' Hsm Text

-- | Contains a tag. A tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | The key of the tag.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | The value of the tag.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - The key of the tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The value of the tag.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | The key of the tag.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The value of the tag.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text


-- | Adds or overwrites one or more tags for the specified AWS CloudHSM
--   cluster.
module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.TagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResource</a> smart constructor.
data TagResource
TagResource' :: Text -> [Tag] -> TagResource

-- | The cluster identifier (ID) for the cluster that you are tagging. To
--   find the cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
[$sel:resourceId:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> Text

-- | A list of one or more tags.
[$sel:tagList:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResource</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_resourceId</a> -
--   The cluster identifier (ID) for the cluster that you are tagging. To
--   find the cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_tagList</a> - A list
--   of one or more tags.
newTagResource :: Text -> TagResource

-- | The cluster identifier (ID) for the cluster that you are tagging. To
--   find the cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
tagResource_resourceId :: Lens' TagResource Text

-- | A list of one or more tags.
tagResource_tagList :: Lens' TagResource [Tag]

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResourceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data TagResourceResponse
TagResourceResponse' :: Int -> TagResourceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:TagResourceResponse'] :: TagResourceResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResourceResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:TagResourceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>tagResourceResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newTagResourceResponse :: Int -> TagResourceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
tagResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' TagResourceResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.TagResource.TagResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.TagResource.TagResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.TagResource.TagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.TagResource.TagResource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.TagResource.TagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.TagResource.TagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.TagResource.TagResource


-- | Restores a specified AWS CloudHSM backup that is in the
--   <tt>PENDING_DELETION</tt> state. For mor information on deleting a
--   backup, see DeleteBackup.
module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.RestoreBackup

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newRestoreBackup</a> smart constructor.
data RestoreBackup
RestoreBackup' :: Text -> RestoreBackup

-- | The ID of the backup to be restored. To find the ID of a backup, use
--   the DescribeBackups operation.
[$sel:backupId:RestoreBackup'] :: RestoreBackup -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RestoreBackup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupId:RestoreBackup'</a>, <a>restoreBackup_backupId</a> -
--   The ID of the backup to be restored. To find the ID of a backup, use
--   the DescribeBackups operation.
newRestoreBackup :: Text -> RestoreBackup

-- | The ID of the backup to be restored. To find the ID of a backup, use
--   the DescribeBackups operation.
restoreBackup_backupId :: Lens' RestoreBackup Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newRestoreBackupResponse</a> smart constructor.
data RestoreBackupResponse
RestoreBackupResponse' :: Maybe Backup -> Int -> RestoreBackupResponse

-- | Information on the <tt>Backup</tt> object created.
[$sel:backup:RestoreBackupResponse'] :: RestoreBackupResponse -> Maybe Backup

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:RestoreBackupResponse'] :: RestoreBackupResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>RestoreBackupResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backup:RestoreBackupResponse'</a>,
--   <a>restoreBackupResponse_backup</a> - Information on the
--   <tt>Backup</tt> object created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:RestoreBackupResponse'</a>,
--   <a>restoreBackupResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newRestoreBackupResponse :: Int -> RestoreBackupResponse

-- | Information on the <tt>Backup</tt> object created.
restoreBackupResponse_backup :: Lens' RestoreBackupResponse (Maybe Backup)

-- | The response's http status code.
restoreBackupResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' RestoreBackupResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.RestoreBackup.RestoreBackup
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.RestoreBackup.RestoreBackup
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.RestoreBackup.RestoreBackup
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.RestoreBackup.RestoreBackup
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.RestoreBackup.RestoreBackupResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.RestoreBackup.RestoreBackupResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.RestoreBackup.RestoreBackupResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.RestoreBackup.RestoreBackupResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.RestoreBackup.RestoreBackup
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.RestoreBackup.RestoreBackupResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.RestoreBackup.RestoreBackup
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.RestoreBackup.RestoreBackup
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.RestoreBackup.RestoreBackup
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.RestoreBackup.RestoreBackup
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.RestoreBackup.RestoreBackup
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.RestoreBackup.RestoreBackup


-- | Modifies AWS CloudHSM cluster.
module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyCluster

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyCluster</a> smart constructor.
data ModifyCluster
ModifyCluster' :: BackupRetentionPolicy -> Text -> ModifyCluster

-- | A policy that defines how the service retains backups.
[$sel:backupRetentionPolicy:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> BackupRetentionPolicy

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that you want to modify. To find
--   the cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
[$sel:clusterId:ModifyCluster'] :: ModifyCluster -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyCluster</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupRetentionPolicy:ModifyCluster'</a>,
--   <a>modifyCluster_backupRetentionPolicy</a> - A policy that defines how
--   the service retains backups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:ModifyCluster'</a>, <a>modifyCluster_clusterId</a> -
--   The identifier (ID) of the cluster that you want to modify. To find
--   the cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
newModifyCluster :: BackupRetentionPolicy -> Text -> ModifyCluster

-- | A policy that defines how the service retains backups.
modifyCluster_backupRetentionPolicy :: Lens' ModifyCluster BackupRetentionPolicy

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that you want to modify. To find
--   the cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
modifyCluster_clusterId :: Lens' ModifyCluster Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyClusterResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ModifyClusterResponse
ModifyClusterResponse' :: Maybe Cluster -> Int -> ModifyClusterResponse
[$sel:cluster:ModifyClusterResponse'] :: ModifyClusterResponse -> Maybe Cluster

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ModifyClusterResponse'] :: ModifyClusterResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyClusterResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cluster:ModifyClusterResponse'</a>,
--   <a>modifyClusterResponse_cluster</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ModifyClusterResponse'</a>,
--   <a>modifyClusterResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newModifyClusterResponse :: Int -> ModifyClusterResponse

-- | Undocumented member.
modifyClusterResponse_cluster :: Lens' ModifyClusterResponse (Maybe Cluster)

-- | The response's http status code.
modifyClusterResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ModifyClusterResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyCluster.ModifyCluster
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyCluster.ModifyCluster
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyCluster.ModifyCluster
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyCluster.ModifyCluster
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyCluster.ModifyClusterResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyCluster.ModifyClusterResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyCluster.ModifyClusterResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyCluster.ModifyClusterResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyCluster.ModifyCluster
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyCluster.ModifyClusterResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyCluster.ModifyCluster
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyCluster.ModifyCluster
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyCluster.ModifyCluster
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyCluster.ModifyCluster
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyCluster.ModifyCluster
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyCluster.ModifyCluster


-- | Modifies attributes for AWS CloudHSM backup.
module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyBackupAttributes

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyBackupAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data ModifyBackupAttributes
ModifyBackupAttributes' :: Text -> Bool -> ModifyBackupAttributes

-- | The identifier (ID) of the backup to modify. To find the ID of a
--   backup, use the DescribeBackups operation.
[$sel:backupId:ModifyBackupAttributes'] :: ModifyBackupAttributes -> Text

-- | Specifies whether the service should exempt a backup from the
--   retention policy for the cluster. <tt>True</tt> exempts a backup from
--   the retention policy. <tt>False</tt> means the service applies the
--   backup retention policy defined at the cluster.
[$sel:neverExpires:ModifyBackupAttributes'] :: ModifyBackupAttributes -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyBackupAttributes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupId:ModifyBackupAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>modifyBackupAttributes_backupId</a> - The identifier (ID) of the
--   backup to modify. To find the ID of a backup, use the DescribeBackups
--   operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:neverExpires:ModifyBackupAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>modifyBackupAttributes_neverExpires</a> - Specifies whether the
--   service should exempt a backup from the retention policy for the
--   cluster. <tt>True</tt> exempts a backup from the retention policy.
--   <tt>False</tt> means the service applies the backup retention policy
--   defined at the cluster.
newModifyBackupAttributes :: Text -> Bool -> ModifyBackupAttributes

-- | The identifier (ID) of the backup to modify. To find the ID of a
--   backup, use the DescribeBackups operation.
modifyBackupAttributes_backupId :: Lens' ModifyBackupAttributes Text

-- | Specifies whether the service should exempt a backup from the
--   retention policy for the cluster. <tt>True</tt> exempts a backup from
--   the retention policy. <tt>False</tt> means the service applies the
--   backup retention policy defined at the cluster.
modifyBackupAttributes_neverExpires :: Lens' ModifyBackupAttributes Bool

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyBackupAttributesResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ModifyBackupAttributesResponse
ModifyBackupAttributesResponse' :: Maybe Backup -> Int -> ModifyBackupAttributesResponse
[$sel:backup:ModifyBackupAttributesResponse'] :: ModifyBackupAttributesResponse -> Maybe Backup

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ModifyBackupAttributesResponse'] :: ModifyBackupAttributesResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyBackupAttributesResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backup:ModifyBackupAttributesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>modifyBackupAttributesResponse_backup</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ModifyBackupAttributesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>modifyBackupAttributesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newModifyBackupAttributesResponse :: Int -> ModifyBackupAttributesResponse

-- | Undocumented member.
modifyBackupAttributesResponse_backup :: Lens' ModifyBackupAttributesResponse (Maybe Backup)

-- | The response's http status code.
modifyBackupAttributesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ModifyBackupAttributesResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyBackupAttributes.ModifyBackupAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyBackupAttributes.ModifyBackupAttributes
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyBackupAttributes.ModifyBackupAttributes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyBackupAttributes.ModifyBackupAttributes
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyBackupAttributes.ModifyBackupAttributesResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyBackupAttributes.ModifyBackupAttributesResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyBackupAttributes.ModifyBackupAttributesResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyBackupAttributes.ModifyBackupAttributesResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyBackupAttributes.ModifyBackupAttributes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyBackupAttributes.ModifyBackupAttributesResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyBackupAttributes.ModifyBackupAttributes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyBackupAttributes.ModifyBackupAttributes
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyBackupAttributes.ModifyBackupAttributes
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyBackupAttributes.ModifyBackupAttributes
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyBackupAttributes.ModifyBackupAttributes
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ModifyBackupAttributes.ModifyBackupAttributes


-- | Gets a list of tags for the specified AWS CloudHSM cluster.
--   
--   This is a paginated operation, which means that each response might
--   contain only a subset of all the tags. When the response contains only
--   a subset of tags, it includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> value. Use this
--   value in a subsequent <tt>ListTags</tt> request to get more tags. When
--   you receive a response with no <tt>NextToken</tt> (or an empty or null
--   value), that means there are no more tags to get.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ListTags

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTags</a> smart constructor.
data ListTags
ListTags' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> ListTags

-- | The <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you received in the previous
--   response. Use this value to get more tags.
[$sel:nextToken:ListTags'] :: ListTags -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of tags to return in the response. When there are
--   more tags than the number you specify, the response contains a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value.
[$sel:maxResults:ListTags'] :: ListTags -> Maybe Natural

-- | The cluster identifier (ID) for the cluster whose tags you are
--   getting. To find the cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
[$sel:resourceId:ListTags'] :: ListTags -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTags</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListTags'</a>, <a>listTags_nextToken</a> - The
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you received in the previous response.
--   Use this value to get more tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListTags'</a>, <a>listTags_maxResults</a> - The
--   maximum number of tags to return in the response. When there are more
--   tags than the number you specify, the response contains a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:ListTags'</a>, <a>listTags_resourceId</a> - The
--   cluster identifier (ID) for the cluster whose tags you are getting. To
--   find the cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
newListTags :: Text -> ListTags

-- | The <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you received in the previous
--   response. Use this value to get more tags.
listTags_nextToken :: Lens' ListTags (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of tags to return in the response. When there are
--   more tags than the number you specify, the response contains a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value.
listTags_maxResults :: Lens' ListTags (Maybe Natural)

-- | The cluster identifier (ID) for the cluster whose tags you are
--   getting. To find the cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
listTags_resourceId :: Lens' ListTags Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTagsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListTagsResponse
ListTagsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> [Tag] -> ListTagsResponse

-- | An opaque string that indicates that the response contains only a
--   subset of tags. Use this value in a subsequent <tt>ListTags</tt>
--   request to get more tags.
[$sel:nextToken:ListTagsResponse'] :: ListTagsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListTagsResponse'] :: ListTagsResponse -> Int

-- | A list of tags.
[$sel:tagList:ListTagsResponse'] :: ListTagsResponse -> [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTagsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListTags'</a>, <a>listTagsResponse_nextToken</a> -
--   An opaque string that indicates that the response contains only a
--   subset of tags. Use this value in a subsequent <tt>ListTags</tt>
--   request to get more tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListTagsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listTagsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:ListTagsResponse'</a>, <a>listTagsResponse_tagList</a>
--   - A list of tags.
newListTagsResponse :: Int -> ListTagsResponse

-- | An opaque string that indicates that the response contains only a
--   subset of tags. Use this value in a subsequent <tt>ListTags</tt>
--   request to get more tags.
listTagsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListTagsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listTagsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListTagsResponse Int

-- | A list of tags.
listTagsResponse_tagList :: Lens' ListTagsResponse [Tag]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ListTags.ListTags
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ListTags.ListTags
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ListTags.ListTags
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ListTags.ListTags
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ListTags.ListTagsResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ListTags.ListTagsResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ListTags.ListTagsResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ListTags.ListTagsResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ListTags.ListTags
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ListTags.ListTagsResponse
instance Network.AWS.Pager.AWSPager Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ListTags.ListTags
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ListTags.ListTags
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ListTags.ListTags
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ListTags.ListTags
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ListTags.ListTags
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ListTags.ListTags
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.ListTags.ListTags


-- | Claims an AWS CloudHSM cluster by submitting the cluster certificate
--   issued by your issuing certificate authority (CA) and the CA's root
--   certificate. Before you can claim a cluster, you must sign the
--   cluster's certificate signing request (CSR) with your issuing CA. To
--   get the cluster's CSR, use DescribeClusters.
module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.InitializeCluster

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newInitializeCluster</a> smart constructor.
data InitializeCluster
InitializeCluster' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> InitializeCluster

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that you are claiming. To find the
--   cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
[$sel:clusterId:InitializeCluster'] :: InitializeCluster -> Text

-- | The cluster certificate issued (signed) by your issuing certificate
--   authority (CA). The certificate must be in PEM format and can contain
--   a maximum of 5000 characters.
[$sel:signedCert:InitializeCluster'] :: InitializeCluster -> Text

-- | The issuing certificate of the issuing certificate authority (CA) that
--   issued (signed) the cluster certificate. You must use a self-signed
--   certificate. The certificate used to sign the HSM CSR must be directly
--   available, and thus must be the root certificate. The certificate must
--   be in PEM format and can contain a maximum of 5000 characters.
[$sel:trustAnchor:InitializeCluster'] :: InitializeCluster -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InitializeCluster</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:InitializeCluster'</a>,
--   <a>initializeCluster_clusterId</a> - The identifier (ID) of the
--   cluster that you are claiming. To find the cluster ID, use
--   DescribeClusters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:signedCert:InitializeCluster'</a>,
--   <a>initializeCluster_signedCert</a> - The cluster certificate issued
--   (signed) by your issuing certificate authority (CA). The certificate
--   must be in PEM format and can contain a maximum of 5000 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trustAnchor:InitializeCluster'</a>,
--   <a>initializeCluster_trustAnchor</a> - The issuing certificate of the
--   issuing certificate authority (CA) that issued (signed) the cluster
--   certificate. You must use a self-signed certificate. The certificate
--   used to sign the HSM CSR must be directly available, and thus must be
--   the root certificate. The certificate must be in PEM format and can
--   contain a maximum of 5000 characters.
newInitializeCluster :: Text -> Text -> Text -> InitializeCluster

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that you are claiming. To find the
--   cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
initializeCluster_clusterId :: Lens' InitializeCluster Text

-- | The cluster certificate issued (signed) by your issuing certificate
--   authority (CA). The certificate must be in PEM format and can contain
--   a maximum of 5000 characters.
initializeCluster_signedCert :: Lens' InitializeCluster Text

-- | The issuing certificate of the issuing certificate authority (CA) that
--   issued (signed) the cluster certificate. You must use a self-signed
--   certificate. The certificate used to sign the HSM CSR must be directly
--   available, and thus must be the root certificate. The certificate must
--   be in PEM format and can contain a maximum of 5000 characters.
initializeCluster_trustAnchor :: Lens' InitializeCluster Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newInitializeClusterResponse</a> smart constructor.
data InitializeClusterResponse
InitializeClusterResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ClusterState -> Int -> InitializeClusterResponse

-- | A description of the cluster's state.
[$sel:stateMessage:InitializeClusterResponse'] :: InitializeClusterResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The cluster's state.
[$sel:state:InitializeClusterResponse'] :: InitializeClusterResponse -> Maybe ClusterState

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:InitializeClusterResponse'] :: InitializeClusterResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>InitializeClusterResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateMessage:InitializeClusterResponse'</a>,
--   <a>initializeClusterResponse_stateMessage</a> - A description of the
--   cluster's state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:InitializeClusterResponse'</a>,
--   <a>initializeClusterResponse_state</a> - The cluster's state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:InitializeClusterResponse'</a>,
--   <a>initializeClusterResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
