newInitializeClusterResponse :: Int -> InitializeClusterResponse

-- | A description of the cluster's state.
initializeClusterResponse_stateMessage :: Lens' InitializeClusterResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The cluster's state.
initializeClusterResponse_state :: Lens' InitializeClusterResponse (Maybe ClusterState)

-- | The response's http status code.
initializeClusterResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' InitializeClusterResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.InitializeCluster.InitializeCluster
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.InitializeCluster.InitializeCluster
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.InitializeCluster.InitializeCluster
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.InitializeCluster.InitializeCluster
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.InitializeCluster.InitializeClusterResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.InitializeCluster.InitializeClusterResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.InitializeCluster.InitializeClusterResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.InitializeCluster.InitializeClusterResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.InitializeCluster.InitializeCluster
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.InitializeCluster.InitializeClusterResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.InitializeCluster.InitializeCluster
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.InitializeCluster.InitializeCluster
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.InitializeCluster.InitializeCluster
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.InitializeCluster.InitializeCluster
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.InitializeCluster.InitializeCluster
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.InitializeCluster.InitializeCluster


-- | Gets information about AWS CloudHSM clusters.
--   
--   This is a paginated operation, which means that each response might
--   contain only a subset of all the clusters. When the response contains
--   only a subset of clusters, it includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> value. Use
--   this value in a subsequent <tt>DescribeClusters</tt> request to get
--   more clusters. When you receive a response with no <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   (or an empty or null value), that means there are no more clusters to
--   get.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeClusters

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeClusters</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeClusters
DescribeClusters' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> DescribeClusters

-- | One or more filters to limit the items returned in the response.
--   
--   Use the <tt>clusterIds</tt> filter to return only the specified
--   clusters. Specify clusters by their cluster identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>vpcIds</tt> filter to return only the clusters in the
--   specified virtual private clouds (VPCs). Specify VPCs by their VPC
--   identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>states</tt> filter to return only clusters that match the
--   specified state.
[$sel:filters:DescribeClusters'] :: DescribeClusters -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you received in the previous
--   response. Use this value to get more clusters.
[$sel:nextToken:DescribeClusters'] :: DescribeClusters -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of clusters to return in the response. When there
--   are more clusters than the number you specify, the response contains a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value.
[$sel:maxResults:DescribeClusters'] :: DescribeClusters -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeClusters</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:DescribeClusters'</a>, <a>describeClusters_filters</a>
--   - One or more filters to limit the items returned in the response.
--   
--   Use the <tt>clusterIds</tt> filter to return only the specified
--   clusters. Specify clusters by their cluster identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>vpcIds</tt> filter to return only the clusters in the
--   specified virtual private clouds (VPCs). Specify VPCs by their VPC
--   identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>states</tt> filter to return only clusters that match the
--   specified state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:DescribeClusters'</a>,
--   <a>describeClusters_nextToken</a> - The <tt>NextToken</tt> value that
--   you received in the previous response. Use this value to get more
--   clusters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:DescribeClusters'</a>,
--   <a>describeClusters_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of clusters to
--   return in the response. When there are more clusters than the number
--   you specify, the response contains a <tt>NextToken</tt> value.
newDescribeClusters :: DescribeClusters

-- | One or more filters to limit the items returned in the response.
--   
--   Use the <tt>clusterIds</tt> filter to return only the specified
--   clusters. Specify clusters by their cluster identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>vpcIds</tt> filter to return only the clusters in the
--   specified virtual private clouds (VPCs). Specify VPCs by their VPC
--   identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>states</tt> filter to return only clusters that match the
--   specified state.
describeClusters_filters :: Lens' DescribeClusters (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you received in the previous
--   response. Use this value to get more clusters.
describeClusters_nextToken :: Lens' DescribeClusters (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of clusters to return in the response. When there
--   are more clusters than the number you specify, the response contains a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value.
describeClusters_maxResults :: Lens' DescribeClusters (Maybe Natural)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeClustersResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeClustersResponse
DescribeClustersResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Cluster] -> Int -> DescribeClustersResponse

-- | An opaque string that indicates that the response contains only a
--   subset of clusters. Use this value in a subsequent
--   <tt>DescribeClusters</tt> request to get more clusters.
[$sel:nextToken:DescribeClustersResponse'] :: DescribeClustersResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of clusters.
[$sel:clusters:DescribeClustersResponse'] :: DescribeClustersResponse -> Maybe [Cluster]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeClustersResponse'] :: DescribeClustersResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeClustersResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:DescribeClusters'</a>,
--   <a>describeClustersResponse_nextToken</a> - An opaque string that
--   indicates that the response contains only a subset of clusters. Use
--   this value in a subsequent <tt>DescribeClusters</tt> request to get
--   more clusters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusters:DescribeClustersResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeClustersResponse_clusters</a> - A list of clusters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeClustersResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeClustersResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDescribeClustersResponse :: Int -> DescribeClustersResponse

-- | An opaque string that indicates that the response contains only a
--   subset of clusters. Use this value in a subsequent
--   <tt>DescribeClusters</tt> request to get more clusters.
describeClustersResponse_nextToken :: Lens' DescribeClustersResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of clusters.
describeClustersResponse_clusters :: Lens' DescribeClustersResponse (Maybe [Cluster])

-- | The response's http status code.
describeClustersResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeClustersResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeClusters.DescribeClusters
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeClusters.DescribeClusters
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeClusters.DescribeClusters
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeClusters.DescribeClusters
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeClusters.DescribeClustersResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeClusters.DescribeClustersResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeClusters.DescribeClustersResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeClusters.DescribeClustersResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeClusters.DescribeClusters
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeClusters.DescribeClustersResponse
instance Network.AWS.Pager.AWSPager Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeClusters.DescribeClusters
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeClusters.DescribeClusters
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeClusters.DescribeClusters
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeClusters.DescribeClusters
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeClusters.DescribeClusters
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeClusters.DescribeClusters
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeClusters.DescribeClusters


-- | Gets information about backups of AWS CloudHSM clusters.
--   
--   This is a paginated operation, which means that each response might
--   contain only a subset of all the backups. When the response contains
--   only a subset of backups, it includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> value. Use
--   this value in a subsequent <tt>DescribeBackups</tt> request to get
--   more backups. When you receive a response with no <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   (or an empty or null value), that means there are no more backups to
--   get.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeBackups

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeBackups</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeBackups
DescribeBackups' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> DescribeBackups

-- | Designates whether or not to sort the return backups by ascending
--   chronological order of generation.
[$sel:sortAscending:DescribeBackups'] :: DescribeBackups -> Maybe Bool

-- | One or more filters to limit the items returned in the response.
--   
--   Use the <tt>backupIds</tt> filter to return only the specified
--   backups. Specify backups by their backup identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>sourceBackupIds</tt> filter to return only the backups
--   created from a source backup. The <tt>sourceBackupID</tt> of a source
--   backup is returned by the CopyBackupToRegion operation.
--   
--   Use the <tt>clusterIds</tt> filter to return only the backups for the
--   specified clusters. Specify clusters by their cluster identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>states</tt> filter to return only backups that match the
--   specified state.
--   
--   Use the <tt>neverExpires</tt> filter to return backups filtered by the
--   value in the <tt>neverExpires</tt> parameter. <tt>True</tt> returns
--   all backups exempt from the backup retention policy. <tt>False</tt>
--   returns all backups with a backup retention policy defined at the
--   cluster.
[$sel:filters:DescribeBackups'] :: DescribeBackups -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you received in the previous
--   response. Use this value to get more backups.
[$sel:nextToken:DescribeBackups'] :: DescribeBackups -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of backups to return in the response. When there
--   are more backups than the number you specify, the response contains a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value.
[$sel:maxResults:DescribeBackups'] :: DescribeBackups -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeBackups</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sortAscending:DescribeBackups'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackups_sortAscending</a> - Designates whether or not to
--   sort the return backups by ascending chronological order of
--   generation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:DescribeBackups'</a>, <a>describeBackups_filters</a> -
--   One or more filters to limit the items returned in the response.
--   
--   Use the <tt>backupIds</tt> filter to return only the specified
--   backups. Specify backups by their backup identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>sourceBackupIds</tt> filter to return only the backups
--   created from a source backup. The <tt>sourceBackupID</tt> of a source
--   backup is returned by the CopyBackupToRegion operation.
--   
--   Use the <tt>clusterIds</tt> filter to return only the backups for the
--   specified clusters. Specify clusters by their cluster identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>states</tt> filter to return only backups that match the
--   specified state.
--   
--   Use the <tt>neverExpires</tt> filter to return backups filtered by the
--   value in the <tt>neverExpires</tt> parameter. <tt>True</tt> returns
--   all backups exempt from the backup retention policy. <tt>False</tt>
--   returns all backups with a backup retention policy defined at the
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:DescribeBackups'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackups_nextToken</a> - The <tt>NextToken</tt> value that
--   you received in the previous response. Use this value to get more
--   backups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:DescribeBackups'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackups_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of backups to
--   return in the response. When there are more backups than the number
--   you specify, the response contains a <tt>NextToken</tt> value.
newDescribeBackups :: DescribeBackups

-- | Designates whether or not to sort the return backups by ascending
--   chronological order of generation.
describeBackups_sortAscending :: Lens' DescribeBackups (Maybe Bool)

-- | One or more filters to limit the items returned in the response.
--   
--   Use the <tt>backupIds</tt> filter to return only the specified
--   backups. Specify backups by their backup identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>sourceBackupIds</tt> filter to return only the backups
--   created from a source backup. The <tt>sourceBackupID</tt> of a source
--   backup is returned by the CopyBackupToRegion operation.
--   
--   Use the <tt>clusterIds</tt> filter to return only the backups for the
--   specified clusters. Specify clusters by their cluster identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>states</tt> filter to return only backups that match the
--   specified state.
--   
--   Use the <tt>neverExpires</tt> filter to return backups filtered by the
--   value in the <tt>neverExpires</tt> parameter. <tt>True</tt> returns
--   all backups exempt from the backup retention policy. <tt>False</tt>
--   returns all backups with a backup retention policy defined at the
--   cluster.
describeBackups_filters :: Lens' DescribeBackups (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you received in the previous
--   response. Use this value to get more backups.
describeBackups_nextToken :: Lens' DescribeBackups (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of backups to return in the response. When there
--   are more backups than the number you specify, the response contains a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value.
describeBackups_maxResults :: Lens' DescribeBackups (Maybe Natural)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeBackupsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeBackupsResponse
DescribeBackupsResponse' :: Maybe [Backup] -> Maybe Text -> Int -> DescribeBackupsResponse

-- | A list of backups.
[$sel:backups:DescribeBackupsResponse'] :: DescribeBackupsResponse -> Maybe [Backup]

-- | An opaque string that indicates that the response contains only a
--   subset of backups. Use this value in a subsequent
--   <tt>DescribeBackups</tt> request to get more backups.
[$sel:nextToken:DescribeBackupsResponse'] :: DescribeBackupsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeBackupsResponse'] :: DescribeBackupsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeBackupsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backups:DescribeBackupsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupsResponse_backups</a> - A list of backups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:DescribeBackups'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupsResponse_nextToken</a> - An opaque string that
--   indicates that the response contains only a subset of backups. Use
--   this value in a subsequent <tt>DescribeBackups</tt> request to get
--   more backups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeBackupsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newDescribeBackupsResponse :: Int -> DescribeBackupsResponse

-- | A list of backups.
describeBackupsResponse_backups :: Lens' DescribeBackupsResponse (Maybe [Backup])

-- | An opaque string that indicates that the response contains only a
--   subset of backups. Use this value in a subsequent
--   <tt>DescribeBackups</tt> request to get more backups.
describeBackupsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' DescribeBackupsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeBackupsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeBackupsResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeBackups.DescribeBackups
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeBackups.DescribeBackups
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeBackups.DescribeBackups
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeBackups.DescribeBackups
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeBackups.DescribeBackupsResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeBackups.DescribeBackupsResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeBackups.DescribeBackupsResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeBackups.DescribeBackupsResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeBackups.DescribeBackups
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeBackups.DescribeBackupsResponse
instance Network.AWS.Pager.AWSPager Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeBackups.DescribeBackups
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeBackups.DescribeBackups
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeBackups.DescribeBackups
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeBackups.DescribeBackups
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeBackups.DescribeBackups
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeBackups.DescribeBackups
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DescribeBackups.DescribeBackups


-- | Deletes the specified HSM. To specify an HSM, you can use its
--   identifier (ID), the IP address of the HSM's elastic network interface
--   (ENI), or the ID of the HSM's ENI. You need to specify only one of
--   these values. To find these values, use DescribeClusters.
module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteHsm

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteHsm</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteHsm
DeleteHsm' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> DeleteHsm

-- | The identifier (ID) of the elastic network interface (ENI) of the HSM
--   that you are deleting.
[$sel:eniId:DeleteHsm'] :: DeleteHsm -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier (ID) of the HSM that you are deleting.
[$sel:hsmId:DeleteHsm'] :: DeleteHsm -> Maybe Text

-- | The IP address of the elastic network interface (ENI) of the HSM that
--   you are deleting.
[$sel:eniIp:DeleteHsm'] :: DeleteHsm -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that contains the HSM that you are
--   deleting.
[$sel:clusterId:DeleteHsm'] :: DeleteHsm -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteHsm</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eniId:DeleteHsm'</a>, <a>deleteHsm_eniId</a> - The identifier
--   (ID) of the elastic network interface (ENI) of the HSM that you are
--   deleting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmId:DeleteHsm'</a>, <a>deleteHsm_hsmId</a> - The identifier
--   (ID) of the HSM that you are deleting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eniIp:DeleteHsm'</a>, <a>deleteHsm_eniIp</a> - The IP address
--   of the elastic network interface (ENI) of the HSM that you are
--   deleting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:DeleteHsm'</a>, <a>deleteHsm_clusterId</a> - The
--   identifier (ID) of the cluster that contains the HSM that you are
--   deleting.
newDeleteHsm :: Text -> DeleteHsm

-- | The identifier (ID) of the elastic network interface (ENI) of the HSM
--   that you are deleting.
deleteHsm_eniId :: Lens' DeleteHsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the HSM that you are deleting.
deleteHsm_hsmId :: Lens' DeleteHsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP address of the elastic network interface (ENI) of the HSM that
--   you are deleting.
deleteHsm_eniIp :: Lens' DeleteHsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that contains the HSM that you are
--   deleting.
deleteHsm_clusterId :: Lens' DeleteHsm Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteHsmResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteHsmResponse
DeleteHsmResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> DeleteHsmResponse

-- | The identifier (ID) of the HSM that was deleted.
[$sel:hsmId:DeleteHsmResponse'] :: DeleteHsmResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteHsmResponse'] :: DeleteHsmResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteHsmResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmId:DeleteHsm'</a>, <a>deleteHsmResponse_hsmId</a> - The
--   identifier (ID) of the HSM that was deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteHsmResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteHsmResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status code.
newDeleteHsmResponse :: Int -> DeleteHsmResponse

-- | The identifier (ID) of the HSM that was deleted.
deleteHsmResponse_hsmId :: Lens' DeleteHsmResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteHsmResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteHsmResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteHsm.DeleteHsm
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteHsm.DeleteHsm
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteHsm.DeleteHsm
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteHsm.DeleteHsm
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteHsm.DeleteHsmResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteHsm.DeleteHsmResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteHsm.DeleteHsmResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteHsm.DeleteHsmResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteHsm.DeleteHsm

instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteHsm.DeleteHsm
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteHsm.DeleteHsm


-- | Deletes the specified AWS CloudHSM cluster. Before you can delete a
--   cluster, you must delete all HSMs in the cluster. To see if the
--   cluster contains any HSMs, use DescribeClusters. To delete an HSM, use
--   DeleteHsm.
module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteCluster

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteCluster</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteCluster
DeleteCluster' :: Text -> DeleteCluster

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that you are deleting. To find the
--   cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
[$sel:clusterId:DeleteCluster'] :: DeleteCluster -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteCluster</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:DeleteCluster'</a>, <a>deleteCluster_clusterId</a> -
--   The identifier (ID) of the cluster that you are deleting. To find the
--   cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
newDeleteCluster :: Text -> DeleteCluster

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that you are deleting. To find the
--   cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
deleteCluster_clusterId :: Lens' DeleteCluster Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteClusterResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteClusterResponse
DeleteClusterResponse' :: Maybe Cluster -> Int -> DeleteClusterResponse

-- | Information about the cluster that was deleted.
[$sel:cluster:DeleteClusterResponse'] :: DeleteClusterResponse -> Maybe Cluster

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteClusterResponse'] :: DeleteClusterResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteClusterResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cluster:DeleteClusterResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteClusterResponse_cluster</a> - Information about the cluster
--   that was deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteClusterResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteClusterResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newDeleteClusterResponse :: Int -> DeleteClusterResponse

-- | Information about the cluster that was deleted.
deleteClusterResponse_cluster :: Lens' DeleteClusterResponse (Maybe Cluster)

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteClusterResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteClusterResponse Int

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteCluster.DeleteCluster


-- | Deletes a specified AWS CloudHSM backup. A backup can be restored up
--   to 7 days after the DeleteBackup request is made. For more information
--   on restoring a backup, see RestoreBackup.
module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteBackup

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteBackup</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteBackup
DeleteBackup' :: Text -> DeleteBackup

-- | The ID of the backup to be deleted. To find the ID of a backup, use
--   the DescribeBackups operation.
[$sel:backupId:DeleteBackup'] :: DeleteBackup -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteBackup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupId:DeleteBackup'</a>, <a>deleteBackup_backupId</a> - The
--   ID of the backup to be deleted. To find the ID of a backup, use the
--   DescribeBackups operation.
newDeleteBackup :: Text -> DeleteBackup

-- | The ID of the backup to be deleted. To find the ID of a backup, use
--   the DescribeBackups operation.
deleteBackup_backupId :: Lens' DeleteBackup Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteBackupResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteBackupResponse
DeleteBackupResponse' :: Maybe Backup -> Int -> DeleteBackupResponse

-- | Information on the <tt>Backup</tt> object deleted.
[$sel:backup:DeleteBackupResponse'] :: DeleteBackupResponse -> Maybe Backup

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteBackupResponse'] :: DeleteBackupResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteBackupResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backup:DeleteBackupResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteBackupResponse_backup</a> - Information on the
--   <tt>Backup</tt> object deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteBackupResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteBackupResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newDeleteBackupResponse :: Int -> DeleteBackupResponse

-- | Information on the <tt>Backup</tt> object deleted.
deleteBackupResponse_backup :: Lens' DeleteBackupResponse (Maybe Backup)

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteBackupResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteBackupResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteBackup.DeleteBackup
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteBackup.DeleteBackup

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteBackup.DeleteBackup

instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteBackup.DeleteBackup
