instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.DeleteBackup.DeleteBackup


-- | Creates a new hardware security module (HSM) in the specified AWS
--   CloudHSM cluster.
module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateHsm

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateHsm</a> smart constructor.
data CreateHsm
CreateHsm' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateHsm

-- | The HSM's IP address. If you specify an IP address, use an available
--   address from the subnet that maps to the Availability Zone where you
--   are creating the HSM. If you don't specify an IP address, one is
--   chosen for you from that subnet.
[$sel:ipAddress:CreateHsm'] :: CreateHsm -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier (ID) of the HSM's cluster. To find the cluster ID, use
--   DescribeClusters.
[$sel:clusterId:CreateHsm'] :: CreateHsm -> Text

-- | The Availability Zone where you are creating the HSM. To find the
--   cluster's Availability Zones, use DescribeClusters.
[$sel:availabilityZone:CreateHsm'] :: CreateHsm -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateHsm</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipAddress:CreateHsm'</a>, <a>createHsm_ipAddress</a> - The
--   HSM's IP address. If you specify an IP address, use an available
--   address from the subnet that maps to the Availability Zone where you
--   are creating the HSM. If you don't specify an IP address, one is
--   chosen for you from that subnet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:CreateHsm'</a>, <a>createHsm_clusterId</a> - The
--   identifier (ID) of the HSM's cluster. To find the cluster ID, use
--   DescribeClusters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:CreateHsm'</a>,
--   <a>createHsm_availabilityZone</a> - The Availability Zone where you
--   are creating the HSM. To find the cluster's Availability Zones, use
--   DescribeClusters.
newCreateHsm :: Text -> Text -> CreateHsm

-- | The HSM's IP address. If you specify an IP address, use an available
--   address from the subnet that maps to the Availability Zone where you
--   are creating the HSM. If you don't specify an IP address, one is
--   chosen for you from that subnet.
createHsm_ipAddress :: Lens' CreateHsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the HSM's cluster. To find the cluster ID, use
--   DescribeClusters.
createHsm_clusterId :: Lens' CreateHsm Text

-- | The Availability Zone where you are creating the HSM. To find the
--   cluster's Availability Zones, use DescribeClusters.
createHsm_availabilityZone :: Lens' CreateHsm Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateHsmResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateHsmResponse
CreateHsmResponse' :: Maybe Hsm -> Int -> CreateHsmResponse

-- | Information about the HSM that was created.
[$sel:hsm:CreateHsmResponse'] :: CreateHsmResponse -> Maybe Hsm

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateHsmResponse'] :: CreateHsmResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateHsmResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsm:CreateHsmResponse'</a>, <a>createHsmResponse_hsm</a> -
--   Information about the HSM that was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateHsmResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createHsmResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status code.
newCreateHsmResponse :: Int -> CreateHsmResponse

-- | Information about the HSM that was created.
createHsmResponse_hsm :: Lens' CreateHsmResponse (Maybe Hsm)

-- | The response's http status code.
createHsmResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateHsmResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateHsm.CreateHsm
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateHsm.CreateHsm
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateHsm.CreateHsm
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateHsm.CreateHsm
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateHsm.CreateHsmResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateHsm.CreateHsmResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateHsm.CreateHsmResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateHsm.CreateHsmResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateHsm.CreateHsm
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateHsm.CreateHsmResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateHsm.CreateHsm
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateHsm.CreateHsm
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateHsm.CreateHsm
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateHsm.CreateHsm
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateHsm.CreateHsm
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateHsm.CreateHsm


-- | Creates a new AWS CloudHSM cluster.
module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateCluster

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateCluster</a> smart constructor.
data CreateCluster
CreateCluster' :: Maybe BackupRetentionPolicy -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Text -> NonEmpty Text -> CreateCluster

-- | A policy that defines how the service retains backups.
[$sel:backupRetentionPolicy:CreateCluster'] :: CreateCluster -> Maybe BackupRetentionPolicy

-- | Tags to apply to the CloudHSM cluster during creation.
[$sel:tagList:CreateCluster'] :: CreateCluster -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster backup to restore. Use this value
--   to restore the cluster from a backup instead of creating a new
--   cluster. To find the backup ID, use DescribeBackups.
[$sel:sourceBackupId:CreateCluster'] :: CreateCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of HSM to use in the cluster. Currently the only allowed
--   value is <tt>hsm1.medium</tt>.
[$sel:hsmType:CreateCluster'] :: CreateCluster -> Text

-- | The identifiers (IDs) of the subnets where you are creating the
--   cluster. You must specify at least one subnet. If you specify multiple
--   subnets, they must meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>All subnets must be in the same virtual private cloud (VPC).</li>
--   <li>You can specify only one subnet per Availability Zone.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:subnetIds:CreateCluster'] :: CreateCluster -> NonEmpty Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateCluster</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupRetentionPolicy:CreateCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createCluster_backupRetentionPolicy</a> - A policy that defines how
--   the service retains backups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:CreateCluster'</a>, <a>createCluster_tagList</a> -
--   Tags to apply to the CloudHSM cluster during creation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceBackupId:CreateCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createCluster_sourceBackupId</a> - The identifier (ID) of the
--   cluster backup to restore. Use this value to restore the cluster from
--   a backup instead of creating a new cluster. To find the backup ID, use
--   DescribeBackups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmType:CreateCluster'</a>, <a>createCluster_hsmType</a> - The
--   type of HSM to use in the cluster. Currently the only allowed value is
--   <tt>hsm1.medium</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIds:CreateCluster'</a>, <a>createCluster_subnetIds</a> -
--   The identifiers (IDs) of the subnets where you are creating the
--   cluster. You must specify at least one subnet. If you specify multiple
--   subnets, they must meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>All subnets must be in the same virtual private cloud (VPC).</li>
--   <li>You can specify only one subnet per Availability Zone.</li>
--   </ul>
newCreateCluster :: Text -> NonEmpty Text -> CreateCluster

-- | A policy that defines how the service retains backups.
createCluster_backupRetentionPolicy :: Lens' CreateCluster (Maybe BackupRetentionPolicy)

-- | Tags to apply to the CloudHSM cluster during creation.
createCluster_tagList :: Lens' CreateCluster (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster backup to restore. Use this value
--   to restore the cluster from a backup instead of creating a new
--   cluster. To find the backup ID, use DescribeBackups.
createCluster_sourceBackupId :: Lens' CreateCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of HSM to use in the cluster. Currently the only allowed
--   value is <tt>hsm1.medium</tt>.
createCluster_hsmType :: Lens' CreateCluster Text

-- | The identifiers (IDs) of the subnets where you are creating the
--   cluster. You must specify at least one subnet. If you specify multiple
--   subnets, they must meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>All subnets must be in the same virtual private cloud (VPC).</li>
--   <li>You can specify only one subnet per Availability Zone.</li>
--   </ul>
createCluster_subnetIds :: Lens' CreateCluster (NonEmpty Text)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateClusterResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateClusterResponse
CreateClusterResponse' :: Maybe Cluster -> Int -> CreateClusterResponse

-- | Information about the cluster that was created.
[$sel:cluster:CreateClusterResponse'] :: CreateClusterResponse -> Maybe Cluster

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateClusterResponse'] :: CreateClusterResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateClusterResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cluster:CreateClusterResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createClusterResponse_cluster</a> - Information about the cluster
--   that was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateClusterResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createClusterResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newCreateClusterResponse :: Int -> CreateClusterResponse

-- | Information about the cluster that was created.
createClusterResponse_cluster :: Lens' CreateClusterResponse (Maybe Cluster)

-- | The response's http status code.
createClusterResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateClusterResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateCluster.CreateCluster
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateCluster.CreateCluster
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateCluster.CreateCluster
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateCluster.CreateCluster
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateCluster.CreateClusterResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateCluster.CreateClusterResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateCluster.CreateClusterResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateCluster.CreateClusterResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateCluster.CreateCluster
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateCluster.CreateClusterResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateCluster.CreateCluster
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateCluster.CreateCluster
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateCluster.CreateCluster
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateCluster.CreateCluster
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateCluster.CreateCluster
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CreateCluster.CreateCluster


-- | Copy an AWS CloudHSM cluster backup to a different region.
module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CopyBackupToRegion

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCopyBackupToRegion</a> smart constructor.
data CopyBackupToRegion
CopyBackupToRegion' :: Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> CopyBackupToRegion

-- | Tags to apply to the destination backup during creation. If you
--   specify tags, only these tags will be applied to the destination
--   backup. If you do not specify tags, the service copies tags from the
--   source backup to the destination backup.
[$sel:tagList:CopyBackupToRegion'] :: CopyBackupToRegion -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The AWS region that will contain your copied CloudHSM cluster backup.
[$sel:destinationRegion:CopyBackupToRegion'] :: CopyBackupToRegion -> Text

-- | The ID of the backup that will be copied to the destination region.
[$sel:backupId:CopyBackupToRegion'] :: CopyBackupToRegion -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CopyBackupToRegion</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:CopyBackupToRegion'</a>,
--   <a>copyBackupToRegion_tagList</a> - Tags to apply to the destination
--   backup during creation. If you specify tags, only these tags will be
--   applied to the destination backup. If you do not specify tags, the
--   service copies tags from the source backup to the destination backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationRegion:CopyBackupToRegion'</a>,
--   <a>copyBackupToRegion_destinationRegion</a> - The AWS region that will
--   contain your copied CloudHSM cluster backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupId:CopyBackupToRegion'</a>,
--   <a>copyBackupToRegion_backupId</a> - The ID of the backup that will be
--   copied to the destination region.
newCopyBackupToRegion :: Text -> Text -> CopyBackupToRegion

-- | Tags to apply to the destination backup during creation. If you
--   specify tags, only these tags will be applied to the destination
--   backup. If you do not specify tags, the service copies tags from the
--   source backup to the destination backup.
copyBackupToRegion_tagList :: Lens' CopyBackupToRegion (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The AWS region that will contain your copied CloudHSM cluster backup.
copyBackupToRegion_destinationRegion :: Lens' CopyBackupToRegion Text

-- | The ID of the backup that will be copied to the destination region.
copyBackupToRegion_backupId :: Lens' CopyBackupToRegion Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCopyBackupToRegionResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CopyBackupToRegionResponse
CopyBackupToRegionResponse' :: Maybe DestinationBackup -> Int -> CopyBackupToRegionResponse

-- | Information on the backup that will be copied to the destination
--   region, including CreateTimestamp, SourceBackup, SourceCluster, and
--   Source Region. CreateTimestamp of the destination backup will be the
--   same as that of the source backup.
--   
--   You will need to use the <tt>sourceBackupID</tt> returned in this
--   operation to use the DescribeBackups operation on the backup that will
--   be copied to the destination region.
[$sel:destinationBackup:CopyBackupToRegionResponse'] :: CopyBackupToRegionResponse -> Maybe DestinationBackup

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CopyBackupToRegionResponse'] :: CopyBackupToRegionResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CopyBackupToRegionResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationBackup:CopyBackupToRegionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>copyBackupToRegionResponse_destinationBackup</a> - Information on
--   the backup that will be copied to the destination region, including
--   CreateTimestamp, SourceBackup, SourceCluster, and Source Region.
--   CreateTimestamp of the destination backup will be the same as that of
--   the source backup.
--   
--   You will need to use the <tt>sourceBackupID</tt> returned in this
--   operation to use the DescribeBackups operation on the backup that will
--   be copied to the destination region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CopyBackupToRegionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>copyBackupToRegionResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newCopyBackupToRegionResponse :: Int -> CopyBackupToRegionResponse

-- | Information on the backup that will be copied to the destination
--   region, including CreateTimestamp, SourceBackup, SourceCluster, and
--   Source Region. CreateTimestamp of the destination backup will be the
--   same as that of the source backup.
--   
--   You will need to use the <tt>sourceBackupID</tt> returned in this
--   operation to use the DescribeBackups operation on the backup that will
--   be copied to the destination region.
copyBackupToRegionResponse_destinationBackup :: Lens' CopyBackupToRegionResponse (Maybe DestinationBackup)

-- | The response's http status code.
copyBackupToRegionResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CopyBackupToRegionResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CopyBackupToRegion.CopyBackupToRegion
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CopyBackupToRegion.CopyBackupToRegion
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CopyBackupToRegion.CopyBackupToRegion
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CopyBackupToRegion.CopyBackupToRegion
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CopyBackupToRegion.CopyBackupToRegionResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CopyBackupToRegion.CopyBackupToRegionResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CopyBackupToRegion.CopyBackupToRegionResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CopyBackupToRegion.CopyBackupToRegionResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CopyBackupToRegion.CopyBackupToRegion
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CopyBackupToRegion.CopyBackupToRegionResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CopyBackupToRegion.CopyBackupToRegion
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CopyBackupToRegion.CopyBackupToRegion
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CopyBackupToRegion.CopyBackupToRegion
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CopyBackupToRegion.CopyBackupToRegion
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CopyBackupToRegion.CopyBackupToRegion
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.CopyBackupToRegion.CopyBackupToRegion


-- | Removes the specified tag or tags from the specified AWS CloudHSM
--   cluster.
module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.UntagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUntagResource</a> smart constructor.
data UntagResource
UntagResource' :: Text -> NonEmpty Text -> UntagResource

-- | The cluster identifier (ID) for the cluster whose tags you are
--   removing. To find the cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
[$sel:resourceId:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> Text

-- | A list of one or more tag keys for the tags that you are removing.
--   Specify only the tag keys, not the tag values.
[$sel:tagKeyList:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> NonEmpty Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UntagResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:UntagResource'</a>, <a>untagResource_resourceId</a>
--   - The cluster identifier (ID) for the cluster whose tags you are
--   removing. To find the cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagKeyList:UntagResource'</a>, <a>untagResource_tagKeyList</a>
--   - A list of one or more tag keys for the tags that you are removing.
--   Specify only the tag keys, not the tag values.
newUntagResource :: Text -> NonEmpty Text -> UntagResource

-- | The cluster identifier (ID) for the cluster whose tags you are
--   removing. To find the cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
untagResource_resourceId :: Lens' UntagResource Text

-- | A list of one or more tag keys for the tags that you are removing.
--   Specify only the tag keys, not the tag values.
untagResource_tagKeyList :: Lens' UntagResource (NonEmpty Text)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUntagResourceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UntagResourceResponse
UntagResourceResponse' :: Int -> UntagResourceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UntagResourceResponse'] :: UntagResourceResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UntagResourceResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UntagResourceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>untagResourceResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newUntagResourceResponse :: Int -> UntagResourceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
untagResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UntagResourceResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.UntagResource.UntagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.UntagResource.UntagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.UntagResource.UntagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.UntagResource.UntagResourceResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.UntagResource.UntagResourceResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.UntagResource.UntagResource


module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Lens

-- | One or more filters to limit the items returned in the response.
--   
--   Use the <tt>clusterIds</tt> filter to return only the specified
--   clusters. Specify clusters by their cluster identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>vpcIds</tt> filter to return only the clusters in the
--   specified virtual private clouds (VPCs). Specify VPCs by their VPC
--   identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>states</tt> filter to return only clusters that match the
--   specified state.
describeClusters_filters :: Lens' DescribeClusters (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you received in the previous
--   response. Use this value to get more clusters.
describeClusters_nextToken :: Lens' DescribeClusters (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of clusters to return in the response. When there
--   are more clusters than the number you specify, the response contains a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value.
describeClusters_maxResults :: Lens' DescribeClusters (Maybe Natural)

-- | An opaque string that indicates that the response contains only a
--   subset of clusters. Use this value in a subsequent
--   <tt>DescribeClusters</tt> request to get more clusters.
describeClustersResponse_nextToken :: Lens' DescribeClustersResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of clusters.
describeClustersResponse_clusters :: Lens' DescribeClustersResponse (Maybe [Cluster])

-- | The response's http status code.
describeClustersResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeClustersResponse Int

-- | The ID of the backup to be deleted. To find the ID of a backup, use
--   the DescribeBackups operation.
deleteBackup_backupId :: Lens' DeleteBackup Text

-- | Information on the <tt>Backup</tt> object deleted.
deleteBackupResponse_backup :: Lens' DeleteBackupResponse (Maybe Backup)

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteBackupResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteBackupResponse Int

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that you are claiming. To find the
--   cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
initializeCluster_clusterId :: Lens' InitializeCluster Text

-- | The cluster certificate issued (signed) by your issuing certificate
--   authority (CA). The certificate must be in PEM format and can contain
--   a maximum of 5000 characters.
initializeCluster_signedCert :: Lens' InitializeCluster Text

-- | The issuing certificate of the issuing certificate authority (CA) that
--   issued (signed) the cluster certificate. You must use a self-signed
--   certificate. The certificate used to sign the HSM CSR must be directly
--   available, and thus must be the root certificate. The certificate must
--   be in PEM format and can contain a maximum of 5000 characters.
initializeCluster_trustAnchor :: Lens' InitializeCluster Text

-- | A description of the cluster's state.
initializeClusterResponse_stateMessage :: Lens' InitializeClusterResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The cluster's state.
initializeClusterResponse_state :: Lens' InitializeClusterResponse (Maybe ClusterState)

-- | The response's http status code.
initializeClusterResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' InitializeClusterResponse Int

-- | The HSM's IP address. If you specify an IP address, use an available
--   address from the subnet that maps to the Availability Zone where you
--   are creating the HSM. If you don't specify an IP address, one is
--   chosen for you from that subnet.
createHsm_ipAddress :: Lens' CreateHsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the HSM's cluster. To find the cluster ID, use
--   DescribeClusters.
createHsm_clusterId :: Lens' CreateHsm Text

-- | The Availability Zone where you are creating the HSM. To find the
--   cluster's Availability Zones, use DescribeClusters.
createHsm_availabilityZone :: Lens' CreateHsm Text

-- | Information about the HSM that was created.
createHsmResponse_hsm :: Lens' CreateHsmResponse (Maybe Hsm)

-- | The response's http status code.
createHsmResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateHsmResponse Int

-- | Designates whether or not to sort the return backups by ascending
--   chronological order of generation.
describeBackups_sortAscending :: Lens' DescribeBackups (Maybe Bool)

-- | One or more filters to limit the items returned in the response.
--   
--   Use the <tt>backupIds</tt> filter to return only the specified
--   backups. Specify backups by their backup identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>sourceBackupIds</tt> filter to return only the backups
--   created from a source backup. The <tt>sourceBackupID</tt> of a source
--   backup is returned by the CopyBackupToRegion operation.
--   
--   Use the <tt>clusterIds</tt> filter to return only the backups for the
--   specified clusters. Specify clusters by their cluster identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>states</tt> filter to return only backups that match the
--   specified state.
--   
--   Use the <tt>neverExpires</tt> filter to return backups filtered by the
--   value in the <tt>neverExpires</tt> parameter. <tt>True</tt> returns
--   all backups exempt from the backup retention policy. <tt>False</tt>
--   returns all backups with a backup retention policy defined at the
--   cluster.
describeBackups_filters :: Lens' DescribeBackups (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you received in the previous
--   response. Use this value to get more backups.
describeBackups_nextToken :: Lens' DescribeBackups (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of backups to return in the response. When there
--   are more backups than the number you specify, the response contains a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value.
describeBackups_maxResults :: Lens' DescribeBackups (Maybe Natural)

-- | A list of backups.
describeBackupsResponse_backups :: Lens' DescribeBackupsResponse (Maybe [Backup])

-- | An opaque string that indicates that the response contains only a
--   subset of backups. Use this value in a subsequent
--   <tt>DescribeBackups</tt> request to get more backups.
describeBackupsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' DescribeBackupsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeBackupsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeBackupsResponse Int

-- | Tags to apply to the destination backup during creation. If you
--   specify tags, only these tags will be applied to the destination
--   backup. If you do not specify tags, the service copies tags from the
--   source backup to the destination backup.
copyBackupToRegion_tagList :: Lens' CopyBackupToRegion (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The AWS region that will contain your copied CloudHSM cluster backup.
copyBackupToRegion_destinationRegion :: Lens' CopyBackupToRegion Text

-- | The ID of the backup that will be copied to the destination region.
copyBackupToRegion_backupId :: Lens' CopyBackupToRegion Text

-- | Information on the backup that will be copied to the destination
--   region, including CreateTimestamp, SourceBackup, SourceCluster, and
--   Source Region. CreateTimestamp of the destination backup will be the
--   same as that of the source backup.
--   
--   You will need to use the <tt>sourceBackupID</tt> returned in this
--   operation to use the DescribeBackups operation on the backup that will
--   be copied to the destination region.
copyBackupToRegionResponse_destinationBackup :: Lens' CopyBackupToRegionResponse (Maybe DestinationBackup)

-- | The response's http status code.
copyBackupToRegionResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CopyBackupToRegionResponse Int

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that you are deleting. To find the
--   cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
deleteCluster_clusterId :: Lens' DeleteCluster Text

-- | Information about the cluster that was deleted.
deleteClusterResponse_cluster :: Lens' DeleteClusterResponse (Maybe Cluster)

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteClusterResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteClusterResponse Int

-- | A policy that defines how the service retains backups.
createCluster_backupRetentionPolicy :: Lens' CreateCluster (Maybe BackupRetentionPolicy)

-- | Tags to apply to the CloudHSM cluster during creation.
createCluster_tagList :: Lens' CreateCluster (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster backup to restore. Use this value
--   to restore the cluster from a backup instead of creating a new
--   cluster. To find the backup ID, use DescribeBackups.
createCluster_sourceBackupId :: Lens' CreateCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of HSM to use in the cluster. Currently the only allowed
--   value is <tt>hsm1.medium</tt>.
createCluster_hsmType :: Lens' CreateCluster Text

-- | The identifiers (IDs) of the subnets where you are creating the
--   cluster. You must specify at least one subnet. If you specify multiple
--   subnets, they must meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>All subnets must be in the same virtual private cloud (VPC).</li>
--   <li>You can specify only one subnet per Availability Zone.</li>
--   </ul>
createCluster_subnetIds :: Lens' CreateCluster (NonEmpty Text)

-- | Information about the cluster that was created.
createClusterResponse_cluster :: Lens' CreateClusterResponse (Maybe Cluster)

-- | The response's http status code.
createClusterResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateClusterResponse Int

-- | The ID of the backup to be restored. To find the ID of a backup, use
--   the DescribeBackups operation.
restoreBackup_backupId :: Lens' RestoreBackup Text

-- | Information on the <tt>Backup</tt> object created.
restoreBackupResponse_backup :: Lens' RestoreBackupResponse (Maybe Backup)

-- | The response's http status code.
restoreBackupResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' RestoreBackupResponse Int

-- | The identifier (ID) of the elastic network interface (ENI) of the HSM
--   that you are deleting.
deleteHsm_eniId :: Lens' DeleteHsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the HSM that you are deleting.
deleteHsm_hsmId :: Lens' DeleteHsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP address of the elastic network interface (ENI) of the HSM that
--   you are deleting.
deleteHsm_eniIp :: Lens' DeleteHsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that contains the HSM that you are
--   deleting.
deleteHsm_clusterId :: Lens' DeleteHsm Text

-- | The identifier (ID) of the HSM that was deleted.
deleteHsmResponse_hsmId :: Lens' DeleteHsmResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteHsmResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteHsmResponse Int

-- | A policy that defines how the service retains backups.
modifyCluster_backupRetentionPolicy :: Lens' ModifyCluster BackupRetentionPolicy

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that you want to modify. To find
--   the cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
modifyCluster_clusterId :: Lens' ModifyCluster Text

-- | Undocumented member.
modifyClusterResponse_cluster :: Lens' ModifyClusterResponse (Maybe Cluster)

-- | The response's http status code.
modifyClusterResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ModifyClusterResponse Int

-- | The cluster identifier (ID) for the cluster that you are tagging. To
--   find the cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
tagResource_resourceId :: Lens' TagResource Text

-- | A list of one or more tags.
tagResource_tagList :: Lens' TagResource [Tag]

-- | The response's http status code.
tagResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' TagResourceResponse Int

-- | The <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you received in the previous
--   response. Use this value to get more tags.
listTags_nextToken :: Lens' ListTags (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of tags to return in the response. When there are
--   more tags than the number you specify, the response contains a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value.
listTags_maxResults :: Lens' ListTags (Maybe Natural)

-- | The cluster identifier (ID) for the cluster whose tags you are
--   getting. To find the cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
listTags_resourceId :: Lens' ListTags Text

-- | An opaque string that indicates that the response contains only a
--   subset of tags. Use this value in a subsequent <tt>ListTags</tt>
--   request to get more tags.
listTagsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListTagsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listTagsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListTagsResponse Int

-- | A list of tags.
listTagsResponse_tagList :: Lens' ListTagsResponse [Tag]

-- | The cluster identifier (ID) for the cluster whose tags you are
--   removing. To find the cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
untagResource_resourceId :: Lens' UntagResource Text

-- | A list of one or more tag keys for the tags that you are removing.
--   Specify only the tag keys, not the tag values.
untagResource_tagKeyList :: Lens' UntagResource (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
untagResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UntagResourceResponse Int

-- | The identifier (ID) of the backup to modify. To find the ID of a
--   backup, use the DescribeBackups operation.
modifyBackupAttributes_backupId :: Lens' ModifyBackupAttributes Text

-- | Specifies whether the service should exempt a backup from the
--   retention policy for the cluster. <tt>True</tt> exempts a backup from
--   the retention policy. <tt>False</tt> means the service applies the
--   backup retention policy defined at the cluster.
modifyBackupAttributes_neverExpires :: Lens' ModifyBackupAttributes Bool

-- | Undocumented member.
modifyBackupAttributesResponse_backup :: Lens' ModifyBackupAttributesResponse (Maybe Backup)

-- | The response's http status code.
modifyBackupAttributesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ModifyBackupAttributesResponse Int

-- | The date and time when the backup will be permanently deleted.
backup_deleteTimestamp :: Lens' Backup (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster containing the source backup from
--   which the new backup was copied.
backup_sourceCluster :: Lens' Backup (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the service should exempt a backup from the
--   retention policy for the cluster. <tt>True</tt> exempts a backup from
--   the retention policy. <tt>False</tt> means the service applies the
--   backup retention policy defined at the cluster.
backup_neverExpires :: Lens' Backup (Maybe Bool)

-- | The AWS Region that contains the source backup from which the new
--   backup was copied.
backup_sourceRegion :: Lens' Backup (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags for the backup.
backup_tagList :: Lens' Backup (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The identifier (ID) of the source backup from which the new backup was
--   copied.
backup_sourceBackup :: Lens' Backup (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that was backed up.
backup_clusterId :: Lens' Backup (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the backup was created.
backup_createTimestamp :: Lens' Backup (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time when the backup was copied from a source backup.
backup_copyTimestamp :: Lens' Backup (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The state of the backup.
backup_backupState :: Lens' Backup (Maybe BackupState)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the backup.
backup_backupId :: Lens' Backup Text

-- | Use a value between 7 - 379.
backupRetentionPolicy_value :: Lens' BackupRetentionPolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of backup retention policy. For the <tt>DAYS</tt> type, the
--   value is the number of days to retain backups.
backupRetentionPolicy_type :: Lens' BackupRetentionPolicy (Maybe BackupRetentionType)

-- | The HSM hardware certificate issued (signed) by the hardware
--   manufacturer.
certificates_manufacturerHardwareCertificate :: Lens' Certificates (Maybe Text)

-- | The cluster's certificate signing request (CSR). The CSR exists only
--   when the cluster's state is <tt>UNINITIALIZED</tt>.
certificates_clusterCsr :: Lens' Certificates (Maybe Text)

-- | The HSM certificate issued (signed) by the HSM hardware.
certificates_hsmCertificate :: Lens' Certificates (Maybe Text)

-- | The cluster certificate issued (signed) by the issuing certificate
--   authority (CA) of the cluster's owner.
certificates_clusterCertificate :: Lens' Certificates (Maybe Text)

-- | The HSM hardware certificate issued (signed) by AWS CloudHSM.
certificates_awsHardwareCertificate :: Lens' Certificates (Maybe Text)

-- | The default password for the cluster's Pre-Crypto Officer (PRECO)
--   user.
cluster_preCoPassword :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of the cluster's state.
cluster_stateMessage :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The cluster's state.
cluster_state :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe ClusterState)

-- | A map from availability zone to the cluster’s subnet in that
--   availability zone.
cluster_subnetMapping :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A policy that defines how the service retains backups.
cluster_backupRetentionPolicy :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe BackupRetentionPolicy)

-- | Contains information about the HSMs in the cluster.
cluster_hsms :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [Hsm])

-- | The identifier (ID) of the virtual private cloud (VPC) that contains
--   the cluster.
cluster_vpcId :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags for the cluster.
cluster_tagList :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The identifier (ID) of the backup used to create the cluster. This
--   value exists only when the cluster was created from a backup.
cluster_sourceBackupId :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains one or more certificates or a certificate signing request
--   (CSR).
cluster_certificates :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Certificates)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster's security group.
cluster_securityGroup :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The cluster's identifier (ID).
cluster_clusterId :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the cluster was created.
cluster_createTimestamp :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The cluster's backup policy.
cluster_backupPolicy :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe BackupPolicy)

-- | The type of HSM that the cluster contains.
cluster_hsmType :: Lens' Cluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster containing the source backup from
--   which the new backup was copied.
destinationBackup_sourceCluster :: Lens' DestinationBackup (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS region that contains the source backup from which the new
--   backup was copied.
destinationBackup_sourceRegion :: Lens' DestinationBackup (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the source backup from which the new backup was
--   copied.
destinationBackup_sourceBackup :: Lens' DestinationBackup (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when both the source backup was created.
destinationBackup_createTimestamp :: Lens' DestinationBackup (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A description of the HSM's state.
hsm_stateMessage :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The HSM's state.
hsm_state :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe HsmState)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
hsm_eniId :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The subnet that contains the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
hsm_subnetId :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The Availability Zone that contains the HSM.
hsm_availabilityZone :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier (ID) of the cluster that contains the HSM.
hsm_clusterId :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP address of the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
hsm_eniIp :: Lens' Hsm (Maybe Text)

-- | The HSM's identifier (ID).
hsm_hsmId :: Lens' Hsm Text

-- | The key of the tag.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The value of the tag.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text


module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2017-04-28</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   For more information about AWS CloudHSM, see <a>AWS CloudHSM</a> and
--   the <a>AWS CloudHSM User Guide</a>.
module Network.AWS.CloudHSMv2

-- | API version <tt>2017-04-28</tt> of the Amazon CloudHSM V2 SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The request was rejected because of an AWS CloudHSM internal failure.
--   The request can be retried.
_CloudHsmInternalFailureException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because an error occurred.
_CloudHsmServiceException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because it is not a valid request.
_CloudHsmInvalidRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because the requester does not have
--   permission to perform the requested operation.
_CloudHsmAccessDeniedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because it refers to a resource that cannot
--   be found.
_CloudHsmResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because of a tagging failure. Verify the tag
--   conditions in all applicable policies, and then retry the request.
_CloudHsmTagException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeClusters</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeClusters
DescribeClusters' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> DescribeClusters

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeClusters</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:DescribeClusters'</a>, <a>describeClusters_filters</a>
--   - One or more filters to limit the items returned in the response.
--   
--   Use the <tt>clusterIds</tt> filter to return only the specified
--   clusters. Specify clusters by their cluster identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>vpcIds</tt> filter to return only the clusters in the
--   specified virtual private clouds (VPCs). Specify VPCs by their VPC
--   identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>states</tt> filter to return only clusters that match the
--   specified state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:DescribeClusters'</a>,
--   <a>describeClusters_nextToken</a> - The <tt>NextToken</tt> value that
--   you received in the previous response. Use this value to get more
--   clusters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:DescribeClusters'</a>,
--   <a>describeClusters_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of clusters to
--   return in the response. When there are more clusters than the number
--   you specify, the response contains a <tt>NextToken</tt> value.
newDescribeClusters :: DescribeClusters

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeClustersResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeClustersResponse
DescribeClustersResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Cluster] -> Int -> DescribeClustersResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeClustersResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:DescribeClusters'</a>,
--   <a>describeClustersResponse_nextToken</a> - An opaque string that
--   indicates that the response contains only a subset of clusters. Use
--   this value in a subsequent <tt>DescribeClusters</tt> request to get
--   more clusters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusters:DescribeClustersResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeClustersResponse_clusters</a> - A list of clusters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeClustersResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeClustersResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDescribeClustersResponse :: Int -> DescribeClustersResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteBackup</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteBackup
DeleteBackup' :: Text -> DeleteBackup

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteBackup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupId:DeleteBackup'</a>, <a>deleteBackup_backupId</a> - The
--   ID of the backup to be deleted. To find the ID of a backup, use the
--   DescribeBackups operation.
newDeleteBackup :: Text -> DeleteBackup

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteBackupResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteBackupResponse
DeleteBackupResponse' :: Maybe Backup -> Int -> DeleteBackupResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteBackupResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backup:DeleteBackupResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteBackupResponse_backup</a> - Information on the
--   <tt>Backup</tt> object deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteBackupResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteBackupResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newDeleteBackupResponse :: Int -> DeleteBackupResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newInitializeCluster</a> smart constructor.
data InitializeCluster
InitializeCluster' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> InitializeCluster

-- | Create a value of <a>InitializeCluster</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:InitializeCluster'</a>,
--   <a>initializeCluster_clusterId</a> - The identifier (ID) of the
--   cluster that you are claiming. To find the cluster ID, use
--   DescribeClusters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:signedCert:InitializeCluster'</a>,
--   <a>initializeCluster_signedCert</a> - The cluster certificate issued
--   (signed) by your issuing certificate authority (CA). The certificate
--   must be in PEM format and can contain a maximum of 5000 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trustAnchor:InitializeCluster'</a>,
--   <a>initializeCluster_trustAnchor</a> - The issuing certificate of the
--   issuing certificate authority (CA) that issued (signed) the cluster
--   certificate. You must use a self-signed certificate. The certificate
--   used to sign the HSM CSR must be directly available, and thus must be
--   the root certificate. The certificate must be in PEM format and can
--   contain a maximum of 5000 characters.
newInitializeCluster :: Text -> Text -> Text -> InitializeCluster

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newInitializeClusterResponse</a> smart constructor.
data InitializeClusterResponse
InitializeClusterResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ClusterState -> Int -> InitializeClusterResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>InitializeClusterResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateMessage:InitializeClusterResponse'</a>,
--   <a>initializeClusterResponse_stateMessage</a> - A description of the
--   cluster's state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:InitializeClusterResponse'</a>,
--   <a>initializeClusterResponse_state</a> - The cluster's state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:InitializeClusterResponse'</a>,
--   <a>initializeClusterResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newInitializeClusterResponse :: Int -> InitializeClusterResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateHsm</a> smart constructor.
data CreateHsm
CreateHsm' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateHsm

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateHsm</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipAddress:CreateHsm'</a>, <a>createHsm_ipAddress</a> - The
--   HSM's IP address. If you specify an IP address, use an available
--   address from the subnet that maps to the Availability Zone where you
--   are creating the HSM. If you don't specify an IP address, one is
--   chosen for you from that subnet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:CreateHsm'</a>, <a>createHsm_clusterId</a> - The
--   identifier (ID) of the HSM's cluster. To find the cluster ID, use
--   DescribeClusters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:CreateHsm'</a>,
--   <a>createHsm_availabilityZone</a> - The Availability Zone where you
--   are creating the HSM. To find the cluster's Availability Zones, use
--   DescribeClusters.
newCreateHsm :: Text -> Text -> CreateHsm

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateHsmResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateHsmResponse
CreateHsmResponse' :: Maybe Hsm -> Int -> CreateHsmResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateHsmResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsm:CreateHsmResponse'</a>, <a>createHsmResponse_hsm</a> -
--   Information about the HSM that was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateHsmResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createHsmResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status code.
newCreateHsmResponse :: Int -> CreateHsmResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeBackups</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeBackups
DescribeBackups' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> DescribeBackups

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeBackups</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sortAscending:DescribeBackups'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackups_sortAscending</a> - Designates whether or not to
--   sort the return backups by ascending chronological order of
--   generation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:DescribeBackups'</a>, <a>describeBackups_filters</a> -
--   One or more filters to limit the items returned in the response.
--   
--   Use the <tt>backupIds</tt> filter to return only the specified
--   backups. Specify backups by their backup identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>sourceBackupIds</tt> filter to return only the backups
--   created from a source backup. The <tt>sourceBackupID</tt> of a source
--   backup is returned by the CopyBackupToRegion operation.
--   
--   Use the <tt>clusterIds</tt> filter to return only the backups for the
--   specified clusters. Specify clusters by their cluster identifier (ID).
--   
--   Use the <tt>states</tt> filter to return only backups that match the
--   specified state.
--   
--   Use the <tt>neverExpires</tt> filter to return backups filtered by the
--   value in the <tt>neverExpires</tt> parameter. <tt>True</tt> returns
--   all backups exempt from the backup retention policy. <tt>False</tt>
--   returns all backups with a backup retention policy defined at the
--   cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:DescribeBackups'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackups_nextToken</a> - The <tt>NextToken</tt> value that
--   you received in the previous response. Use this value to get more
--   backups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:DescribeBackups'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackups_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of backups to
--   return in the response. When there are more backups than the number
--   you specify, the response contains a <tt>NextToken</tt> value.
newDescribeBackups :: DescribeBackups

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeBackupsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeBackupsResponse
DescribeBackupsResponse' :: Maybe [Backup] -> Maybe Text -> Int -> DescribeBackupsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeBackupsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backups:DescribeBackupsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupsResponse_backups</a> - A list of backups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:DescribeBackups'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupsResponse_nextToken</a> - An opaque string that
--   indicates that the response contains only a subset of backups. Use
--   this value in a subsequent <tt>DescribeBackups</tt> request to get
--   more backups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeBackupsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newDescribeBackupsResponse :: Int -> DescribeBackupsResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCopyBackupToRegion</a> smart constructor.
data CopyBackupToRegion
CopyBackupToRegion' :: Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> CopyBackupToRegion

-- | Create a value of <a>CopyBackupToRegion</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:CopyBackupToRegion'</a>,
--   <a>copyBackupToRegion_tagList</a> - Tags to apply to the destination
--   backup during creation. If you specify tags, only these tags will be
--   applied to the destination backup. If you do not specify tags, the
--   service copies tags from the source backup to the destination backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationRegion:CopyBackupToRegion'</a>,
--   <a>copyBackupToRegion_destinationRegion</a> - The AWS region that will
--   contain your copied CloudHSM cluster backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupId:CopyBackupToRegion'</a>,
--   <a>copyBackupToRegion_backupId</a> - The ID of the backup that will be
--   copied to the destination region.
newCopyBackupToRegion :: Text -> Text -> CopyBackupToRegion

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCopyBackupToRegionResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CopyBackupToRegionResponse
CopyBackupToRegionResponse' :: Maybe DestinationBackup -> Int -> CopyBackupToRegionResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>CopyBackupToRegionResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationBackup:CopyBackupToRegionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>copyBackupToRegionResponse_destinationBackup</a> - Information on
--   the backup that will be copied to the destination region, including
--   CreateTimestamp, SourceBackup, SourceCluster, and Source Region.
--   CreateTimestamp of the destination backup will be the same as that of
--   the source backup.
--   
--   You will need to use the <tt>sourceBackupID</tt> returned in this
--   operation to use the DescribeBackups operation on the backup that will
--   be copied to the destination region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CopyBackupToRegionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>copyBackupToRegionResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newCopyBackupToRegionResponse :: Int -> CopyBackupToRegionResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateCluster</a> smart constructor.
data CreateCluster
CreateCluster' :: Maybe BackupRetentionPolicy -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Text -> NonEmpty Text -> CreateCluster

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateCluster</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupRetentionPolicy:CreateCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createCluster_backupRetentionPolicy</a> - A policy that defines how
--   the service retains backups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:CreateCluster'</a>, <a>createCluster_tagList</a> -
--   Tags to apply to the CloudHSM cluster during creation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceBackupId:CreateCluster'</a>,
--   <a>createCluster_sourceBackupId</a> - The identifier (ID) of the
--   cluster backup to restore. Use this value to restore the cluster from
--   a backup instead of creating a new cluster. To find the backup ID, use
--   DescribeBackups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmType:CreateCluster'</a>, <a>createCluster_hsmType</a> - The
--   type of HSM to use in the cluster. Currently the only allowed value is
--   <tt>hsm1.medium</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIds:CreateCluster'</a>, <a>createCluster_subnetIds</a> -
--   The identifiers (IDs) of the subnets where you are creating the
--   cluster. You must specify at least one subnet. If you specify multiple
--   subnets, they must meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>All subnets must be in the same virtual private cloud (VPC).</li>
--   <li>You can specify only one subnet per Availability Zone.</li>
--   </ul>
newCreateCluster :: Text -> NonEmpty Text -> CreateCluster

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateClusterResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateClusterResponse
CreateClusterResponse' :: Maybe Cluster -> Int -> CreateClusterResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateClusterResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cluster:CreateClusterResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createClusterResponse_cluster</a> - Information about the cluster
--   that was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateClusterResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createClusterResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newCreateClusterResponse :: Int -> CreateClusterResponse

--   deleting.

--   identifier (ID) of the cluster that contains the HSM that you are

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTags</a> smart constructor.
data ListTags

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTags</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListTags'</a>, <a>listTags_nextToken</a> - The
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value that you received in the previous response.
--   Use this value to get more tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListTags'</a>, <a>listTags_maxResults</a> - The
--   maximum number of tags to return in the response. When there are more
--   tags than the number you specify, the response contains a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:ListTags'</a>, <a>listTags_resourceId</a> - The
--   cluster identifier (ID) for the cluster whose tags you are getting. To
--   find the cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
newListTags :: Text -> ListTags

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTagsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListTagsResponse

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListTags'</a>, <a>listTagsResponse_nextToken</a> -
--   An opaque string that indicates that the response contains only a
--   subset of tags. Use this value in a subsequent <tt>ListTags</tt>
--   request to get more tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListTagsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listTagsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:ListTagsResponse'</a>, <a>listTagsResponse_tagList</a>
--   - A list of tags.
newListTagsResponse :: Int -> ListTagsResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUntagResource</a> smart constructor.
data UntagResource

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:UntagResource'</a>, <a>untagResource_resourceId</a>
--   - The cluster identifier (ID) for the cluster whose tags you are
--   removing. To find the cluster ID, use DescribeClusters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagKeyList:UntagResource'</a>, <a>untagResource_tagKeyList</a>
--   - A list of one or more tag keys for the tags that you are removing.
--   Specify only the tag keys, not the tag values.
newUntagResource :: Text -> NonEmpty Text -> UntagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUntagResourceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UntagResourceResponse
UntagResourceResponse' :: Int -> UntagResourceResponse

--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding

newUntagResourceResponse :: Int -> UntagResourceResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyBackupAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data ModifyBackupAttributes
ModifyBackupAttributes' :: Text -> Bool -> ModifyBackupAttributes

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyBackupAttributes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupId:ModifyBackupAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>modifyBackupAttributes_backupId</a> - The identifier (ID) of the
--   backup to modify. To find the ID of a backup, use the DescribeBackups
--   operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:neverExpires:ModifyBackupAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>modifyBackupAttributes_neverExpires</a> - Specifies whether the
--   service should exempt a backup from the retention policy for the
--   cluster. <tt>True</tt> exempts a backup from the retention policy.
--   <tt>False</tt> means the service applies the backup retention policy
--   defined at the cluster.
newModifyBackupAttributes :: Text -> Bool -> ModifyBackupAttributes

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyBackupAttributesResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ModifyBackupAttributesResponse
ModifyBackupAttributesResponse' :: Maybe Backup -> Int -> ModifyBackupAttributesResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyBackupAttributesResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backup:ModifyBackupAttributesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>modifyBackupAttributesResponse_backup</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ModifyBackupAttributesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>modifyBackupAttributesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newModifyBackupAttributesResponse :: Int -> ModifyBackupAttributesResponse
newtype BackupPolicy
BackupPolicy' :: Text -> BackupPolicy
[fromBackupPolicy] :: BackupPolicy -> Text
pattern BackupPolicy_DEFAULT :: BackupPolicy
newtype BackupRetentionType
BackupRetentionType' :: Text -> BackupRetentionType
[fromBackupRetentionType] :: BackupRetentionType -> Text
pattern BackupRetentionType_DAYS :: BackupRetentionType
newtype BackupState
BackupState' :: Text -> BackupState
[fromBackupState] :: BackupState -> Text
pattern BackupState_CREATE_IN_PROGRESS :: BackupState
pattern BackupState_DELETED :: BackupState
pattern BackupState_PENDING_DELETION :: BackupState
pattern BackupState_READY :: BackupState
newtype ClusterState
ClusterState' :: Text -> ClusterState
[fromClusterState] :: ClusterState -> Text
pattern ClusterState_ACTIVE :: ClusterState
pattern ClusterState_CREATE_IN_PROGRESS :: ClusterState
pattern ClusterState_DEGRADED :: ClusterState
pattern ClusterState_DELETED :: ClusterState
pattern ClusterState_DELETE_IN_PROGRESS :: ClusterState
pattern ClusterState_INITIALIZED :: ClusterState
pattern ClusterState_INITIALIZE_IN_PROGRESS :: ClusterState
pattern ClusterState_UNINITIALIZED :: ClusterState
pattern ClusterState_UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS :: ClusterState
newtype HsmState
HsmState' :: Text -> HsmState
[fromHsmState] :: HsmState -> Text
pattern HsmState_ACTIVE :: HsmState
pattern HsmState_CREATE_IN_PROGRESS :: HsmState
pattern HsmState_DEGRADED :: HsmState
pattern HsmState_DELETED :: HsmState
pattern HsmState_DELETE_IN_PROGRESS :: HsmState

-- | Contains information about a backup of an AWS CloudHSM cluster. All
--   backup objects contain the <tt>BackupId</tt>, <tt>BackupState</tt>,
--   <tt>ClusterId</tt>, and <tt>CreateTimestamp</tt> parameters. Backups
--   that were copied into a destination region additionally contain the
--   <tt>CopyTimestamp</tt>, <tt>SourceBackup</tt>, <tt>SourceCluster</tt>,
--   and <tt>SourceRegion</tt> parameters. A backup that is pending
--   deletion will include the <tt>DeleteTimestamp</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackup</a> smart constructor.
data Backup
Backup' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe BackupState -> Text -> Backup

-- | Create a value of <a>Backup</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteTimestamp:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_deleteTimestamp</a> -
--   The date and time when the backup will be permanently deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceCluster:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_sourceCluster</a> - The
--   identifier (ID) of the cluster containing the source backup from which
--   the new backup was copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:neverExpires:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_neverExpires</a> -
--   Specifies whether the service should exempt a backup from the
--   retention policy for the cluster. <tt>True</tt> exempts a backup from
--   the retention policy. <tt>False</tt> means the service applies the
--   backup retention policy defined at the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceRegion:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_sourceRegion</a> - The AWS
--   Region that contains the source backup from which the new backup was
--   copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_tagList</a> - The list of tags
--   for the backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceBackup:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_sourceBackup</a> - The
--   identifier (ID) of the source backup from which the new backup was
--   copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_clusterId</a> - The
--   identifier (ID) of the cluster that was backed up.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createTimestamp:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_createTimestamp</a> -
--   The date and time when the backup was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copyTimestamp:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_copyTimestamp</a> - The
--   date and time when the backup was copied from a source backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupState:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_backupState</a> - The state
--   of the backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupId:Backup'</a>, <a>backup_backupId</a> - The identifier
--   (ID) of the backup.
newBackup :: Text -> Backup

-- | A policy that defines the number of days to retain backups.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupRetentionPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data BackupRetentionPolicy
BackupRetentionPolicy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe BackupRetentionType -> BackupRetentionPolicy

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupRetentionPolicy</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:BackupRetentionPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>backupRetentionPolicy_value</a> - Use a value between 7 - 379.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':BackupRetentionPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>backupRetentionPolicy_type</a> - The type of backup retention
--   policy. For the <tt>DAYS</tt> type, the value is the number of days to
--   retain backups.
newBackupRetentionPolicy :: BackupRetentionPolicy

-- | Contains one or more certificates or a certificate signing request
--   (CSR).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCertificates</a> smart constructor.
data Certificates
Certificates' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Certificates

-- | Create a value of <a>Certificates</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:manufacturerHardwareCertificate:Certificates'</a>,
--   <a>certificates_manufacturerHardwareCertificate</a> - The HSM hardware
--   certificate issued (signed) by the hardware manufacturer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterCsr:Certificates'</a>, <a>certificates_clusterCsr</a> -
--   The cluster's certificate signing request (CSR). The CSR exists only
--   when the cluster's state is <tt>UNINITIALIZED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmCertificate:Certificates'</a>,
--   <a>certificates_hsmCertificate</a> - The HSM certificate issued
--   (signed) by the HSM hardware.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterCertificate:Certificates'</a>,
--   <a>certificates_clusterCertificate</a> - The cluster certificate
--   issued (signed) by the issuing certificate authority (CA) of the
--   cluster's owner.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsHardwareCertificate:Certificates'</a>,
--   <a>certificates_awsHardwareCertificate</a> - The HSM hardware
--   certificate issued (signed) by AWS CloudHSM.
newCertificates :: Certificates

-- | Contains information about an AWS CloudHSM cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCluster</a> smart constructor.
data Cluster
Cluster' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ClusterState -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe BackupRetentionPolicy -> Maybe [Hsm] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Certificates -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe BackupPolicy -> Maybe Text -> Cluster

-- | Create a value of <a>Cluster</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:preCoPassword:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_preCoPassword</a> - The
--   default password for the cluster's Pre-Crypto Officer (PRECO) user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateMessage:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_stateMessage</a> - A
--   description of the cluster's state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_state</a> - The cluster's
--   state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetMapping:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_subnetMapping</a> - A
--   map from availability zone to the cluster’s subnet in that
--   availability zone.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupRetentionPolicy:Cluster'</a>,
--   <a>cluster_backupRetentionPolicy</a> - A policy that defines how the
--   service retains backups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsms:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_hsms</a> - Contains information
--   about the HSMs in the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_vpcId</a> - The identifier (ID)
--   of the virtual private cloud (VPC) that contains the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_tagList</a> - The list of
--   tags for the cluster.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceBackupId:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_sourceBackupId</a> -
--   The identifier (ID) of the backup used to create the cluster. This
--   value exists only when the cluster was created from a backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificates:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_certificates</a> -
--   Contains one or more certificates or a certificate signing request
--   (CSR).
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroup:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_securityGroup</a> - The
--   identifier (ID) of the cluster's security group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_clusterId</a> - The
--   cluster's identifier (ID).
--   
--   <a>$sel:createTimestamp:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_createTimestamp</a> -
--   The date and time when the cluster was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPolicy:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_backupPolicy</a> - The
--   cluster's backup policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmType:Cluster'</a>, <a>cluster_hsmType</a> - The type of HSM
--   that the cluster contains.
newCluster :: Cluster

-- | Contains information about the backup that will be copied and created
--   by the CopyBackupToRegion operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDestinationBackup</a> smart constructor.
data DestinationBackup
DestinationBackup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> DestinationBackup

-- | Create a value of <a>DestinationBackup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceCluster:DestinationBackup'</a>,
--   <a>destinationBackup_sourceCluster</a> - The identifier (ID) of the
--   cluster containing the source backup from which the new backup was
--   copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceRegion:DestinationBackup'</a>,
--   <a>destinationBackup_sourceRegion</a> - The AWS region that contains
--   the source backup from which the new backup was copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceBackup:DestinationBackup'</a>,
--   <a>destinationBackup_sourceBackup</a> - The identifier (ID) of the
--   source backup from which the new backup was copied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createTimestamp:DestinationBackup'</a>,
--   <a>destinationBackup_createTimestamp</a> - The date and time when both
--   the source backup was created.
newDestinationBackup :: DestinationBackup

-- | Contains information about a hardware security module (HSM) in an AWS
--   CloudHSM cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHsm</a> smart constructor.
data Hsm
Hsm' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe HsmState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Hsm

-- | Create a value of <a>Hsm</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateMessage:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_stateMessage</a> - A description
--   of the HSM's state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_state</a> - The HSM's state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eniId:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_eniId</a> - The identifier (ID) of the
--   HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetId:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_subnetId</a> - The subnet that
--   contains the HSM's elastic network interface (ENI).
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_availabilityZone</a> - The
--   Availability Zone that contains the HSM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clusterId:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_clusterId</a> - The identifier (ID)
--   of the cluster that contains the HSM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eniIp:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_eniIp</a> - The IP address of the HSM's
--   elastic network interface (ENI).
--   
--   <a>$sel:hsmId:Hsm'</a>, <a>hsm_hsmId</a> - The HSM's identifier (ID).
newHsm :: Text -> Hsm

-- | Contains a tag. A tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - The key of the tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The value of the tag.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag
